cumalter: <entryFree id="n11875" type="gloss" key="cumalter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cumalter</orth> <itype>significat cum altero, dictum ab antiquis ita brevitatis causā, ut sodes pro si audes, scilicet pro scias licet, sis pro si vis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
cumanus: <entryFree id="n11876" type="main" key="Cu_ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cumae, II.</entryFree>
cumatilis: <entryFree id="n11877" type="greek" key="cu_ma_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūmātĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cȳm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">ku=ma</foreign>, with the Lat. ending ilis</etym>. <sense id="n11877.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj., of the waves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11877.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">sea-colored, water-colored, blue</hi>: colos, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 548, 11</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 114 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n11877.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūmātĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bluish garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cumatium: <entryFree id="n11878" type="main" key="cu_ma^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūmătĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. cymatium.</entryFree>
cumba: <entryFree id="n11879" type="main" key="cumba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cumba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cymba.</entryFree>
cumera: <entryFree id="n11880" type="main" key="cu^me^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 34</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 7</bibl> ib.) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kama/ra</foreign>, Lat. camera], <sense id="n11880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chest, box</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">basket</hi>, to keep grain in, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 53</bibl> Acro; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 30</bibl>; for the utensils of a bride, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 63, 12</bibl>; Varr. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
cuminatus: <entryFree id="n11881" type="main" key="cu^mi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmīnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cym-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuminum</etym>, <sense id="n11881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seasoned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mixed with cumin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11881.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmīnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">cumin-spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:29" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cumininus: <entryFree id="n11882" type="hapax" key="cu^mi_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmīnīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cym-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cumin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuminum: <entryFree id="n11883" type="greek" key="cu^mi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmīnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cym-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/mi=non</foreign>, <sense id="n11883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cumin, a plant</hi>: Cuminum (Cyminum), Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">said to produce paleness,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:159 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 57, § 159 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsangue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:55" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cummaxime: <entryFree id="n11884" type="main" key="cummaxi^me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cummaxĭme</orth>, v. 2. cum, I. G.</entryFree>
cummis: <entryFree id="n11885" type="main" key="cummis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cummis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cummi</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, v. gummi.</entryFree>
cumprime: <entryFree id="n11886" type="main" key="cumpri_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cumprīmē</orth>, <sense id="n11886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., especially, particularly</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 14</bibl>: adprime crebrius est, cumprime rarius, traductumque ex eo est, quod cumprimis dicebant pro eo, quod est imprimis, Gell. ib.</sense></entryFree>
cumprimis: <entryFree id="n11887" type="main" key="cumpri_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cumprīmis</orth>, v. 1. cum, II. D.</entryFree>
cumque: <entryFree id="n11888" type="main" key="cumque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cumquĕ</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">quomquĕ</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cunquĕ</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cum-que</etym>, serves for the generalizing of any action, event, time, etc., <sense id="n11888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">however, whenever, howsoever, whensoever, -ever, -soever</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11888.1" n="I" level="1"> Usu. with pronn. and pronom. advv.: quicumque, qualiscumque, etc., ubicumque, quotienscumque, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11888.2" n="II" level="1"> Very rarely standing alone: <cit><quote lang="la">quae demant cumque dolorem,</quote> <trans><tr>which remove pain in general, any pain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solis lumina cumque Inserti fundunt radii per opaca domorum,</quote> <trans><tr>in whatever manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cumque salve Rite vocanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 15</bibl></cit> (quotiescumque te vocavero, Schol.): aurum cumque a possessore confertur, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 32; cf. Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 288 (who denies the use of cumque except with relatives).!*? In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl>, the reading is most prob. equitatumque qui regat habeto; so B. and K.; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cumulare: <entryFree id="n11889" type="main" key="cu^mu^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = commissura renum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 6, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 2</bibl> Schneid. <sense id="n11889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cumulate: <entryFree id="n11890" type="main" key="cu^mu^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cumulo, <sense id="n11890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cumulatim: <entryFree id="n11891" type="main" key="cu^mu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cumulatus</etym>, <sense id="n11891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abundantly, in heaps, in abundance</hi> (ante- and post-class., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">positum in doliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">739</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cumulatus: <entryFree id="n11892" type="main" key="cu^mu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cumulo.</entryFree>
cumulo: <entryFree id="n11893" type="main" key="cu^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to form into a heap, to accumulate, heap</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pile up</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n11893.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11893.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (mostly <cb n="CUMU" /> post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in Curt. and Tac.): materiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:989" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 989</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:518" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 518</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma in ingentem acervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyram truncis nemorumque ruinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11893.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia principatūs vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores in eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum honorum atque opum in me cumulasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 21: propemodum saeculi res in illum unum diem fortuna cumulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11893.4" n="II" level="1"> With special access. ideas (class.). </sense><sense id="n11893.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To augment by heaping up, to increase, heap, amass, accumulate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11893.6" n="1" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus funere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1237</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 8</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum usuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aliis nefariis cumulant atque adaugent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alio scelere hoc scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicam gloriam eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11893.7" n="2" level="3"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accesserunt quae cumularent religiones animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11893.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make full by heaping up, to fill full, fill, overload</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11893.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11893.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum strage semiruti muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera Thyesteis mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulatae flore ministrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:451" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aras honore, donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:204" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 204</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11893.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">altos lacus fervida musta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulata ligula salis cocti,</quote> <trans><tr>a full spoon, spoonful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11893.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11893.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum non confiteri cumulari me maximo gaudio, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ponebas cumulatum aliquem plurimis voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: nunc meum cor cumulatur irā, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplici dedecore cumulata domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orator omni laude cumulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot honoribus cumulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vitio cumulata est Graecorum natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tot adversis cumulant,</quote> <trans><tr>overwhelm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n11893.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: (summum bonum) cumulatur ex integritate corporis et ex mentis ratione perfecta, <hi rend="ital">is made complete, perfect</hi>, = completus, absolvitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 40</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11893.15" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cumulandum gaudium (meum) conspectum mihi tuum defuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>in order to make my joy full, complete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n11893.16" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Increased, augmented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem mensurā reddere quā acceperis aut etiam cumulatiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria cumulatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 60, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11893.17" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Filled full, full, complete, perfect</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11893.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum accessit ad amorem, ut mirarer locum fuisse augendi in eo, quod mihi jam pridem cumulatum etiam videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sentire et facere perfectae cumulataeque virtutis (est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 86</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam ... cumulatam morte remittam, i. e. cumulate referam,</quote> <trans><tr>shall abundantly reward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 436</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11893.19" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: ineptitudinis cumulatus, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 128, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum cumulatissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭ-lātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in rich abundance, abundantly, copiously</hi> (freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. very rare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 3 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 54</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cumulus: <entryFree id="n11894" type="main" key="cu^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. çva, to swell; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kue/w, ku/w</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ku=ma</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, as coming to a point, <hi rend="ital">a pile, a mass piled up</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the signif. II.): in hoc immenso aliarum super alias acervatarum legum cumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium coacervatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 48, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus obrutum superstratis Gallorum cumulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 19</bibl></cit>; and: armorum cumulos coacervare <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesorum corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminens (aquae in poculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 105</bibl></cit>: insequitur cumulo praeruptus aquae mons. <hi rend="ital">follows with its mass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 105</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 498</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11894.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A heap added to an accumulated mass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a full measure</hi> (cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. auctarium, p. 14, 17 Müll.), <hi rend="ital">a surplus, overplus, accession, addition, increase; a summit, point, crown</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 26</bibl>: ut ad illam praedam damnatio Sex. Roscii<pb n="497" /> <cb n="CUNC" />  velut cumulus accedat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam laetitiam meam magnus ex illius adventu cumulus accedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 19</bibl></cit> (18): <cit><quote lang="la">cumulus commendationis tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cui gloriae amplior adhuc cumulus accessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accesserint in cumulum manubiae vestrorum imperatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>as an addition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cumulum artibus adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum beneficium tuum magno cumulo auxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Otho pontificatus honoratis jam senibus cumulum dignitatis addidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille equites, cumulus prosperis aut subsidium laborantibus, ducerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro mercedis cumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 472</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11894.2" n="B" level="2"> In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">peroratio, quam cumulum quidam, alii conclusionem vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. § 1; 8, 3, 88.</sense></entryFree>
cuna: <entryFree id="n11895" type="main" key="cu_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cunae.</entryFree>
cunabula: <entryFree id="n11896" type="main" key="cu_na_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūnābŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cunae</etym>, <sense id="n11896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cradle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11896.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">resting-place</hi> of young animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11896.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11896.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The cradle</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the earliest abode, dwellingplace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis parvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11896.4" n="B" level="2"> Like our <hi rend="ital">cradle</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">birth, origin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primis cunabulis,</quote> <trans><tr>from earliest childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non in cunabulis sed in campo sunt consules facti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not by their descent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primis cunabulis hujus urbis conditae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cunae: <entryFree id="n11897" type="main" key="cu_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Dipt. 112</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cradle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11897.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tune etiam cubitare solitu's in cunis puer?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est cunis, incunabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:167" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:39:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl> et saep.—Of <hi rend="ital">the nests</hi> of young birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11897.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, like our <hi rend="ital">cradle</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">birth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">earliest childhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 313</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 67</bibl>; cf. cunabula, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
cunctabundus: <entryFree id="n11898" type="main" key="cuncta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctābundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cont-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cunctor</etym>, <sense id="n11898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lingering, loitering, delaying</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(milites) cunctabundosque et resistentes egressos castris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam cunctabundus nisi cum in senatu loqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> in Jul. 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctalis: <entryFree id="n11899" type="hapax" key="cuncta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cunctus</etym>, <sense id="n11899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctamen: <entryFree id="n11900" type="hapax" key="cuncta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctāmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cont-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cunctor</etym>, <sense id="n11900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delaying, hesitating</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 24, 416</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctans: <entryFree id="n11901" type="main" key="cunctans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cont-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1.</entryFree>
cunctanter: <entryFree id="n11902" type="main" key="cunctanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctanter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cont-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 2. <sense id="n11902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cunctatio: <entryFree id="n11903" type="main" key="cuncta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cont-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cunctor</etym>, <sense id="n11903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delaying, lingering</hi>, in a good or (more freq.) in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a tarrying, delay, hesitation, doubt</hi> (subject., while mora is object.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and in good prose): danda brevis cogitationi mora ... in hac cunctatione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:157" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium semper adsit, cunctatio absit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni nescio quo modo tardiores sunt ... ita ut non numquam cunctatione ac tarditate ... otium atque dignitatem amittant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major invadendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. temeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propior constantiae (opp.: velocitas juxta formidinem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjectā omni cunctatione adipiscendi magistratus et gerenda res publica est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. sine cunctatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla umquam de morte hominis cunctatio longa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressa et decora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; 9, 9, 2; 10, 96 (97), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:29 al" default="NO">8, 6, 29 al.</bibl>— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctator: <entryFree id="n11904" type="main" key="cuncta_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cont-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who acts with hesitation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tardiness, a delayer, loiterer, lingerer</hi> (not in Cic.); in a bad sense, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctato ex acerrimo bellatore factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">a considerate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cautious person</hi> (magister equitum Fabium) pro cunctatore segnem, pro cauto timidum compellabat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with cautus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cunctator iniqui Labdacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:79" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: Atheniensium populum<cb n="CUNC" />  celerem et supra vires audacem esse ad conandum, Lacedaemoniorum cunctatorem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11905" type="main" key="Cuncta_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cunctātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the dictator</hi> Q. Fabius Maximus (prob. retained as a title of honor, from the reproach of his master of horse; v. 1. cunctator); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 40, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 11</bibl>, and cunctor.</sense></entryFree>
cunctatrix: <entryFree id="n11906" type="main" key="cuncta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctātrix</orth>, <itype>icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cunctator</etym>, <sense id="n11906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hesitates, acts deliberately</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lenta virtus omnis et diuturna cunctatrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 67, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctatus: <entryFree id="n11907" type="spur" key="cuncta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, formerly assumed as <pos>P. a.</pos> of cunctor; in <sense id="n11907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl>; but in all these passages recent edd. read cunctantior, cunctantius; v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
cuncticinus: <entryFree id="n11908" type="hapax" key="cuncti^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cunctuscano</etym>, prop. <sense id="n11908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding all together;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">concordant, harmonious</hi> (opp.simplex), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 905</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctim: <entryFree id="n11909" type="main" key="cunctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cunctus</etym>, <sense id="n11909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all together, in a body, collectively</hi>, for conjunctim (very rare, perh. only in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">cunctim et coacervatim (opp.: singulatim ac discretim),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 9, p. 347, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. 4, p. 43, 39</bibl> Hildebr. (al. cuncti).</sense></entryFree>
cunctiparens: <entryFree id="n11910" type="hapax" key="cuncti^pa^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctĭ-părens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parent of all</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 128.</sense></entryFree>
cunctipotens: <entryFree id="n11911" type="hapax" key="cuncti^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-powerful, omnipotent</hi>: Jesus (i. e. omnipotens), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 7, 56.</sense></entryFree>
cuncto: <entryFree id="n11912" type="main" key="cuncto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuncto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (ante-class. collat. form of cunctor), <sense id="n11912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to delay, hesitate</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 27</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 3 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cunctas? intus alii festinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: cunctant subferre laborem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 72 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
cunctor: <entryFree id="n11913" type="main" key="cunctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctor</orth> (in many MSS. and edd. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">contor</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n11913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> cunctarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 67</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. çank, to be anxious; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/knos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to delay action</hi> (from deliberation or indolence), <hi rend="ital">to linger, loiter, hesitate, doubt</hi> (freq. and class.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11913.1" n="I" level="1"> Of personal subjects. </sense><sense id="n11913.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, so the verse of Ennius upon the dictator Q. Fab. Maximus Cunctator: unus homo nobis cunctando restituit rem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl> (Ann. v. 313 Vahl.; also cited <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 26, 9</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Verg., A. 6, 846,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:242" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 242</bibl></cit> (the idea contained in cunctando is expressed by sedendo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedendo et cunctando bellum gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and by non pugnando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 5, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">assequor omnia si propero, si cunctor amitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an etiam tunc quiesceretis, cunctaremini, timeretis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis cesset ... qui cunctatus fuerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 35, 17</bibl></cit>, and v. cesso: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris militibus cunctantibus, Desilite, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alium exspectantes cunctamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 753</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitā cunctatur et haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 407</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter metum et iram cunctatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille inter pudorem et iram cunctatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctante ad ea Mithridate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad laborem capessendum nihil cunctentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cunctatum apud latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse cunctandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cunctandum neque cessandum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11913.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est cunctandum profiteri, hunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrisque cunctantibus periculum summae rerum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cunctetur ipse propius accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cunctaretur Agrippam morte adficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11913.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vos cunctamini etiam nunc, quid faciatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu cunctatus an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum cunctati, utrumne ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cunctandum existimavit quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11913.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">tardum cunctatur olivum,</quote> <trans><tr>runs slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigescit cunctando plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis contemptus et acris egestas ... videntur cunctarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatur et amnis Rauca sonans revocatque pedem Tiberinus ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 124</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <cb n="CUNE" /> <hi rend="ital">delaying, lingering, dilatory, slow, tardy</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11913.6" n="1" level="3"> Of persons (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">erat cunctantior cautiorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dimicandum cunctantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">familia cunctans ad opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā ac senectā cunctantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. respect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternos aegro cunctantem poplite gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:93" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11913.7" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">tenacious, tough, slow, resisting</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mellis cunctantior actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corripit Aeneas extemplo avidusque refringit Cunctantem (ramum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebas cunctantis exspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:693" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:680" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 680</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slowly, with delay</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:52 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 52 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunctus: <entryFree id="n11914" type="main" key="cunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and more freq. in <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cuncti</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from conjunctus</etym>, <sense id="n11914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all in a body, all together, the whole, all, entire</hi> (cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 15</bibl> Müll.: cuncti significat quidem omnes, sed conjuncti et congregati; very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11914.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11914.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus populusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi fragor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11914.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: provincia, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cunctam militarem disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">a Graeciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11914.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:202" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 202</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11914.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deduntque se ... In dicionem ... cuncti Thebano poplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin cuncti vivi caperentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncti aut magna pars Siccensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope cunctis civibus lucem ingenii sui porrigens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctarum exordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta maria terraeque patebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsulto cuncta simul agebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 66, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mario procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 65:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 65, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum nutu portendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putas unā virtute minora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11914.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11914.7" n="(a)" level="5"> In the gender of the noun (cf. Rudd. 2, p. 80; Zumpt, Gram. § 430; <cit><quote lang="la">Kühner, Gram. II. p. 314): hominum cunctos ingenti corpore praestans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baetica cunctas provinciarum diviti cultu praecedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam cuncta scelerum suorum pro egregiis accipi vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit> Nipperd. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n11914.8" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fem. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viaï cuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 739</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuneatim: <entryFree id="n11915" type="main" key="cu^ne^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cuneo</etym>, <sense id="n11915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a wedge, wedge-shaped</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">constiterunt hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 165</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
cuneatio: <entryFree id="n11916" type="hapax" key="cu^ne^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wedgeshaped point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 47" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuneatus: <entryFree id="n11917" type="main" key="cu^ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cuneo.</entryFree>
cunela: <entryFree id="n11918" type="main" key="cu^ne_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. cunila.</entryFree>
cuneo: <entryFree id="n11919" type="main" key="cu^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cuneus</etym> (rare, and not ante-Aug.; cf. cuneatim). <sense id="n11919.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fasten with wedges, to wedge up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid cuneandum sit in ligno clavisve figendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus lapis facit fornacem, ille, qui latera inclinata cuneavit et interventu suo vinxit,</quote> <trans><tr>the key-stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118, 16</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11919.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to press in, force in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si oratio cohaeret et sequitur, non, si per vim cuneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11919.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make wedge-shaped;</hi> of places: <cit><quote lang="la">(Britannia) iterum se in diversos angulos cuneat triquetra,</quote> <trans><tr>is in the form of a wedge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. cuneus, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Hispania) cuneatur angustiis inter duo maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">pointed like a wedge, wedgeshaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis acumine longo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum montis in angustum dorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma scuti ad imum cuneatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuneolus: <entryFree id="n11920" type="main" key="cu^ne^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wedge, a small gore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 3</bibl>. <pb n="498" /> <cb n="CUNN" /></sense></entryFree>
cuneus: <entryFree id="n11921" type="main" key="cu^ne^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. çā, çān, to sharpen; Lat. cos, cautes</etym>, <sense id="n11921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wedge</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11921.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 18</bibl>: jamque labant cunei, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the plugs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wedges by which the ship's hull was made tight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 514</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannia in cuneum tenuatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is shaped like a wedge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. cuneo, II.—* </sense><sense id="n11921.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cuneo veritatis omnis extruditur haeresis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11921.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11921.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Troops drawn up for battle in the form of a wedge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 269</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 575 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Macedonian phalanx: cohortes invicem sub signis, quae cuneum Macedonicum (phalangem ipsi vocant) si possent, vi perrumperent, emittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Dict. of Antiq.—So of a mob: turbandae rei causā publicani cuneo inruperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a flight of geese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11921.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The wedge-form division of the rows of seats in a theatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tumulum cuneosque theatri perferre, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 664</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 61</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n11921.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spectators</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero cuneis notuit res omnibus,</quote> <trans><tr>all the boxes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11921.7" n="C" level="2"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">the wedge-like space between the different painted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inlaid panels in walls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11922" type="main" key="Cu^ne^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭnĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Lusitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cabo St. Maria, the extreme southern point of Portugal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunicularis: <entryFree id="n11923" type="hapax" key="cu^ni_cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuniculus</etym>, <sense id="n11923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the rabbit, rabbit-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cunicularius: <entryFree id="n11924" type="main" key="cu^ni_cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cuniculus, II. B.</etym>; <sense id="n11924.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in milit. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>a miner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuniculatim: <entryFree id="n11925" type="main" key="cu^ni_cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cuniculus, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n11925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in channels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl>; v. cuniculatus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cuniculator: <entryFree id="n11926" type="main" key="cu^ni_cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> ( = cunicularius), <sense id="n11926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a miner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 2, 418</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuniculatus: <entryFree id="n11927" type="main" key="cu^ni_cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuniculus</etym>, <sense id="n11927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a channel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tube</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 61, § 130</bibl></cit> Sillig and Jan. (al. cuniculatim).</sense></entryFree>
cuniculosus: <entryFree id="n11928" type="hapax" key="cu^ni_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuniculus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n11928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in caves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Celtiberia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuniculus: <entryFree id="n11929" type="foreign" key="cu^ni_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Spanish</etym>, <sense id="n11929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rabbit, cony</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/niklos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ku/niklos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n11929.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:60" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11929.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from their habit of burrowing in the ground; cf. Varr. l. l.; collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 4</bibl>, but perh. an <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> v. Müll. ad loc.), <hi rend="ital">a passage under ground, a hole, pit, cavity, canal</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11929.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 31</bibl>, §§ 128 and 135.— </sense><sense id="n11929.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 22</bibl> (three times); 7, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 30, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad murum cuniculis pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultus vineis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculorum fodinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11929.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res aperte petebatur, ea nunc occulte cuniculis oppugnatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by secret devices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cunila: <entryFree id="n11930" type="main" key="cu^ni_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏnīla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, a species of</hi> origanum; <cit><quote lang="la">form cunila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:169" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 16, 61, § 169</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form conila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunilago: <entryFree id="n11931" type="main" key="cu^ni_la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭnīlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of</hi> cunila, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:171 al" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 16, 63, § 171 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cunina: <entryFree id="n11932" type="main" key="Cu_ni_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūnīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cunae</etym>, <sense id="n11932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess who protects children in the cradle</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 167, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 36</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 96, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunire: <entryFree id="n11933" type="gloss" key="cuni_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunīre</orth> <itype>est stercus facere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 16</bibl> Müll. [cf. inquino, and Sanscr. knuj, to stink].</entryFree>
cunnilingus: <entryFree id="n11934" type="main" key="cunni^lingus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunnĭ-lingus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. cunnum lingens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:59:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 59, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 78, 2 al.</bibl></entryFree>
cunnus: <entryFree id="n11935" type="main" key="cunnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cunnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. çushi, ditch; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kuso/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the female pudenda</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11935.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:90:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 90, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:72:6" default="NO">3, 72, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:81:4" default="NO">3, 81, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 28, 5</bibl>.—Also of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:96:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 96, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11935.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the person, <hi rend="ital">an unchaste</hi> <cb n="CUPI" /> <hi rend="ital">female</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 69, 1 al.</bibl>—As an obscene word, avoided acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cunque: <entryFree id="n11936" type="main" key="cunque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunque</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cumque.</entryFree>
