cunulae: <entryFree id="n11937" type="main" key="cu_nu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūnŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cunae</etym>, <sense id="n11937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cradle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupa: <entryFree id="n11938" type="main" key="cu_pa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ku/ptw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tub, cask, tun, vat</hi>, etc., for holding liquids, esp. wine, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 83, 24 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl> (but acc. to Ernesti, <hi rend="ital">a female vintner;</hi> cf. copa); Caes. B. C: 2, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 420</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also for grain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and for the ashes of the dead,</quote> <trans><tr>a niche</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2697</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4550</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11939" type="greek" key="cu_pa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kw/ph</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott in h. v.), <sense id="n11939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the handle of an oil-mill, a crooked handle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuparius: <entryFree id="n11940" type="main" key="cu_pa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. cupa</etym>, <sense id="n11940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cooper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4176 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cupavo: <entryFree id="n11941" type="main" key="Cu^pa_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭpāvo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Ligurian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupedia: <entryFree id="n11942" type="main" key="cu_pe_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpēdĭa, cūpēdĭnārĭus, cūpēdĭ-um</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūpēdo</orth>, v. cupp-.</entryFree>
cupella: <entryFree id="n11943" type="main" key="cu_pella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. cupa</etym>, <sense id="n11943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cask</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupencus: <entryFree id="n11944" type="main" key="Cu^pencus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭpencus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest of the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 539</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:537" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 537</bibl>; cf.: sane sciendum, cupencum Sabinorum linguā sacerdotem vocari, Serv. ad Verg. l. l.; esp., <hi rend="ital">a priest of Hercules</hi>, Gloss. ap. Serv. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
cupes: <entryFree id="n11945" type="main" key="cu_pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpes</orth>, v. cuppes.</entryFree>
cupide: <entryFree id="n11946" type="main" key="cu^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cupidus <sense id="n11946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cupidineus: <entryFree id="n11947" type="main" key="Cu^pi_di^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭpīdĭnĕus</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. cupido, II. A. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
cupiditas: <entryFree id="n11948" type="main" key="cu^pi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n11948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> rarely -tatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cupidus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a desire, wish, longing</hi>, in a good and (more freq.) in a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n11948.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">a longing, desire</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11948.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insatiabilis quaedam veri videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilis pugnandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justi et magni triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira studiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <trans><tr>appetite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11948.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta cupiditas ad reditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta ad venandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis flagrare cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis confidere propter cupiditatem,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of warm desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de voluntate tuā, ut simul simus, vel studio potius et cupiditate non dubito,</quote> <trans><tr>eager longing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: tanta erat magnificentia apud opulentiores, cupiditas apud humiliores, <hi rend="ital">devotion, enthusiasm</hi>, Auct. B. G. 8, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n11948.5" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a passionate desire, lust, passion, cupidity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11948.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11948.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 30 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps et lubrica dominandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutius exigendi mercedulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 14</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n11948.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel libido vel cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita maxime disjuncta a cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca ac temeraria dominatrix animi cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita hominum sine cupiditate agitabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitas cupiditates atque effrenatas habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domitas habere libidines, coërcere omnes cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 194</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Naso omni carens cupiditate (i. e. non appetens provinciam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem cupiditatemque militum reprehendit,</quote> <trans><tr>immoderate love of fighting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Carnal desire, lust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of animals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the object of desire</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)piqumi/a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus ex inpurissimis faucibus inhonestissimam cupiditatem eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 14, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11948.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A passionate desire for money</hi> or <hi rend="ital">other possessions; avarice, cupidity, covetousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ipsos caecos redderet cupiditas et avaritia et audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 101</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et contemptus pecuniae et cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. abstinentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas causa sceleris fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit> Spald.; 3, 5, 10; 5, 10, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11948.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The passion of love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatis ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam non cupiditate tantā diligere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.14" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Greediness of gain in trade, usury</hi>, <cb n="CUPI" /> <hi rend="ital">overreaching, fraud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.15" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The lust of power, ambition</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non te propria cupiditas, sed aliena utilitas principem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11948.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An undue partiality, spirit of party</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(testes) aut sine ullo studio dicebant, aut cum dissimulatione aliquā cupiditatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupido: <entryFree id="n11949" type="main" key="cu^pi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpīdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpēdo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1082</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1090" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1090</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 45</bibl>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Plant. Am. 2, 2, 210; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 734</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:99" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 99</bibl>; and personified in all authors; <sense id="n11949.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>) [cupidus], access. form of cupiditas, <hi rend="ital">desire, wish, longing, eagerness</hi>, in a good and (more usu.) in a bad sense (very freq. in the poets and histt., esp. in Sall.; twice in Quint., but in Cic. only as personified). </sense><sense id="n11949.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11949.2" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense: cupido cepit miseram nunc me proloqui, etc. (transl. from Eurip. Med. 57: <foreign lang="greek">i(/meros m) u(ph=lqe</foreign>, etc.), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 291 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulum cupido cepit urbis condendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido eum ceperat in verticem montis ascendendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido incessit Aethiopiam invisere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laticum frugumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1093" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1093</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitatis perpetuaeque famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">13: placendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:17 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 17 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n11949.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">res medii cuppedine victae,</quote> <trans><tr>overcome by their tendency to a centre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1082</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11949.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">desire, passion, lust, greed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11949.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum caeca (with avarities),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala vitaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1077" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1077</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immitis uvae (i. e. virginis immaturae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae caeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intempestiva concubitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:689" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 689</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:634" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 634</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilia faciundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (oppidi) potiundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 89:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (rerum) inmodica cupido inter mortales est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populos ad cupidinem novae fortunae erigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae dominationis cupidinibus flagrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11949.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines cupidine caeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1153</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1090" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1090</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuppedinis acres curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 15</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">femineus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 734</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 39</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo provectas Romanorum cupidines, ut non corpora, ne senectam quidam aut virginitatem inpollutam relinquant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11949.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11949.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The desire that springs from love, desire, love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">differor Cupidine ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">visae virginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 906</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 210</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 68</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">me, Contactum nullis ante cupidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11949.9" n="2" level="3"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭpīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the god of love, Cupid</hi>, son of Venus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl> (3, 18, 21); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 453</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 366</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 14 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the form CVPEDO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1367</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater saeva Cupidinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.; 4, 1, 5 al.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of sculptured figures: exstant caelati scyphi ... Myos in eādem aede Silenos et Cupidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:41" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 41</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n11949.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭpīdĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Cupid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 157</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lovely, charming</hi> ( = formosus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11949.11" n="B" level="2"> In animals, <hi rend="ital">the sexual impulse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi cupidine sollicitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11949.12" n="C" level="2"> (Cf. cupidus, II. A. 2., and cupiditas, II. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Avarice, covetousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Narcissum incusat cupidinis ac praedarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 57</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11949.13" n="2" level="3"> Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupido sordidus,</quote> <trans><tr>sordid Avarice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cupidus: <entryFree id="n11950" type="main" key="cu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cupio</etym>, <sense id="n11950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">longing, desiring, desirous, eager</hi>, in a good and bad sense, <hi rend="ital">wishing, loving, fond</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen., abl., inf., in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11950.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n11950.2" n="1" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n11950.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus videndi cupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">huc redeundi, abeundi a milite, Vosque hic videndi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeundi domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde spectandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 162</bibl></cit>: satis faciendi rei publicae, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="499" /> <cb n="CUPI" /> 2, 98: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentionis quam veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 104</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11950.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 215</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11950.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidus in perspiciendā cognoscendāque rerum naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11950.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quicquam cupido optantique obtigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidum vires Deficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11950.7" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum Vis cupida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11950.8" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">passionately desiring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">longing for, eager, greedy, lustful, passionate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11950.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11950.10" n="1" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n11950.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit> (not vino, v. Ritschl ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum novarum, imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum novarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujuscumque motūs novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius rei nisi imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n11950.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidos moderatis anteferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 14, 32</bibl></cit> (10, 22): <cit><quote lang="la">non esse mirandum, qui in illā re turpis aut cupidus aut petulans fuerit, hāc quoque in re eum deliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emit homo cupidus (for which, just before, cupiditate incensus),</quote> <trans><tr>eager to purchase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultus cupidusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidusque et amata relinquere pernix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:165 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 165 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11950.13" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 26 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11950.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11950.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Longing from love, pining, languishing for, loving</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11950.16" n="a" level="4"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">neu me cupidum eo (sc. ad uxorem ducendam) impulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 375</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:74" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 679</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidi nomen amantis habe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11950.17" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac cupidae mentis satiata libido est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11950.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Desirous of money, avaricious, covetous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo cupidorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo castus ac non cupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl>; so in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11950.19" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Devoted to a party, favoring any one, partial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestores vehementer (Verris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidi et irati et conjurati testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit> (6, 11): <cit><quote lang="la">judices (with infesti, invidentes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24, 66</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭ-pĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., eagerly</hi>, in a good and bad sense, <hi rend="ital">zealously, passionately, vehemently, ardently, warmly, partially</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 100</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32, 3 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cupiennius: <entryFree id="n11951" type="main" key="Cu^pi^enni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭpĭennĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupiens: <entryFree id="n11952" type="main" key="cu^pi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cupio.</entryFree>
cupienter: <entryFree id="n11953" type="main" key="cu^pi^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cupio, <sense id="n11953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cupio: <entryFree id="n11954" type="main" key="cu^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n11954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi> cŭpīret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 72</bibl>; quoted ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 506 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 879</bibl> P.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr kup, to be in active motion, to be angry; cf. recupero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to long for a thing, to desire, wish</hi> (designating a natural, involuntary inclination, or an unbridled or passionate desire, while volo indicates an energetic will, and opto a deliberate wish or choice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116, 2</bibl>; cf. Klotz in Jahn's Neues Jahrb. 1834, II. p. 119 sq.; freq. in every per. and species of composition); constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc., inf., acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf., acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">part., ut, ne</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11954.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11954.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of persons. </sense><sense id="n11954.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istuc tam cupide cupis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bonum illud esse, quod cupias ardenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupere eadem, eadem odisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum alius, alius agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 11</bibl></cit>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">novas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 70, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto plura parasti, Tanto plura cupis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(magistratus, imperia, etc.) minime mihi hac tempestate cupienda videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 66</bibl> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: corde cupitus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupitus atque exspectatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars videt hanc visamque cupit potiturque cupitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupitus aetatis flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CUPL" /> 770; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 847: cujus rei semper cupitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem huic cupitum contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 116</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11954.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">emori cupio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Heant. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te celare de phaleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam navare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nostri quid sine imperatore efficere possent perspici cuperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11954.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te tuā frui virtute cupimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: cupio me esse clementem; <cit><quote lang="la">cupio in tantis rei publicae periculis me non dissolutum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Haase ad Reisig, Lect. p. 790: (Pausanias) se tecum affinitate conjungi cupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n11954.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">part.: Cu.</hi> Quis nominat me? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Qui te conventum cupit. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Hau me magis cupis, quam te ego cupio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 25</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio ut impetret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam necesse erit cupere et optare, ut peccet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum est mihi cupere quidem universos ut a me rationes coloniae legerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 47</bibl></cit> (56), 1. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio, ne ... habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 6</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio te quoque sub idem tempus Campania tua remittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 14</bibl></cit> (15), 9.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nolis, cupiunt ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cupit aut metuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with metuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; 1, 16, 65; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortatus suos, omnibus cupientibus ad hostium castra contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl> et saep.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol quamquam domi cupio, opperiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; cf. <pos>P. a.</pos> <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> infra. —With <hi rend="ital">gen. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (puellae) cupiunt tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum vestri cupiunt Lucrina tacita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11954.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">asperiora vina rigari utique cupiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 41, § 250</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11954.8" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to be well disposed, be favorable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclined to one, to favor, to wish well, to be interested for</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">favere et cupere Helvetiis propter eam affinitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego Fundanio non cupio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi Glycerio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: cui maxime, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus causā omnia cum cupio, tum mehercule etiam debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 75, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam mihi tradidit, quem suā causā cupere ac debere intellegebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer ejus causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istius causā cupiunt omnia, qui ab eo benignissime tractati sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:73:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 73, § 180</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl> Halm ad loc.—Hence the phrase cupio omnia quaevis, <hi rend="ital">your wishes are mine;</hi> cf. the Engl., <hi rend="ital">I am entirely at your service</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., desiring, desirous, longing, eager for something</hi> (mostly ante- class. and post-Aug.; most freq. in Plaut. and Tac.). </sense><sense id="n11954.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui (tua amica),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novarum rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonarum artium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erogandae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 24" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: cupientissimus legis, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 291</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n11954.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quibusque bellum invitis aut cupientibus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius cupientissimā plebe consul factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">desirously, earnestly, eagerly</hi>, = cupide (only ante-class.): cupienter cupere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 91, 8</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 337 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">discerpere membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. p. 91:6" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. p. 91, 6</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. v. 543 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cupisco: <entryFree id="n11955" type="main" key="cu^pisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [cupio], <hi rend="ital">to wish, desire</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deum videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Music. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Music. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
cupitor: <entryFree id="n11956" type="main" key="cu^pi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who desires</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wishes</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. exs.): incredibilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 807</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cupitus: <entryFree id="n11957" type="main" key="cu^pi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭpītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. cupio, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.</entryFree>
cupla: <entryFree id="n11958" type="main" key="cu_pla1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = copula, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 19, 6</bibl>. <cb n="CUPR" /></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11959" type="main" key="cu_pla2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. cupula.</entryFree>
cuppedia: <entryFree id="n11960" type="main" key="cuppe_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cuppes</etym>. * <sense id="n11960.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fondness for dainties, daintiness, lickerishness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11960.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur., dainty dishes, delicacies</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjectabamus ad cenulam non cuppedias ciborum, sed argutias quaestionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 13, 2; 7 (6), 16, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30, 1, 20</bibl>; cf. cuppedium.</sense></entryFree>
cuppedinarius: <entryFree id="n11961" type="main" key="cuppe_di^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdĭnārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to dainty dishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicacies</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11961.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Forum,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. 2. cuppedo, and cuppes, II.—</sense><sense id="n11961.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he who prepares delicacies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tidbits, a confectioner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuppedium: <entryFree id="n11962" type="main" key="cuppe_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūp-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cuppes</etym>, <sense id="n11962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tidbit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl> Müll.; mostly <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (a later form <orth extent="full" lang="la">coppādĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:6" default="NO">7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:6" default="NO">8, 6</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">dainty dishes, tidbits, delicacies</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nil moror cuppedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48, 15</bibl> Müll.; cf. cuppes, II.</sense></entryFree>
cuppedo: <entryFree id="n11963" type="main" key="cuppe_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. cupido.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11964" type="main" key="cuppe_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppēdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūp-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orig. a collat. form of cupido, q. v; hence, in partic., a desire for delicacies</etym>, <sense id="n11964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tidbit, delicacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Forum cupedinis,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in Rome where delicacies were sold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl></cit> Müll.; id. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 25</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48, 15</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 14</bibl> (Hildebr.: forum cupidinis); cf. cuppedinarius, and cuppes, II.</sense></entryFree>
cuppes: <entryFree id="n11965" type="main" key="cuppes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuppes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūp-</orth>), <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n11965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., fond of delicacies, dainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiloquentulus, harpago, mendax, cuppes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11965.1" n="II" level="1"> Cuppes et cuppedia antiqui lautiores cibos nominabant; inde et macellum forum cupedinis appellabant, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48, 15</bibl> Müll.; cf. 2. cuppedo.</sense></entryFree>
cupra: <entryFree id="n11966" type="main" key="Cu_pra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūpra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two cities in Picenum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:434" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 434</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūprenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">their inhabitants</hi>, Plin. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
cupressetum: <entryFree id="n11967" type="main" key="cu_^presse_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^pressētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cupressus</etym>, <sense id="n11967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plantation of cypress - trees, a cypress wood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupresseus: <entryFree id="n11968" type="main" key="cu_^presse^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^pressĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cypress, cypress.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cupressifer: <entryFree id="n11969" type="main" key="cu_^pressi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^pressĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cupressus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n11969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cypress - bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erymanthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyllenes jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cupressinus: <entryFree id="n11970" type="greek" key="cu_^pressi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^pressĭnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^press-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 1, 16</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kupari/ssinos</foreign>, <sense id="n11970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cypress, cypress-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 45, § 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cupressus: <entryFree id="n11971" type="greek" key="cu_^pressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^pressus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and less freq. <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n11971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">(m. acc. plur.</hi> rectosque cupressos, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 13</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195</bibl>; rare collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cypărissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 680</bibl>; cf. infra B.; and in late Lat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^pres-sus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 24, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 34</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kupa/rissos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the cypress, an evergreen tree sacred to Pluto and used at funerals</hi>: Cupressus sempervirens, Linn.— <hi rend="ital">Sing. nom.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:212" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 78, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 106</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> cupressi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">151, 1</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 10, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:774" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 598</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">691 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, 30, p. 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 18</bibl>, p. 209.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> cupresso, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 688</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> cupresso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 332</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 22, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:73:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 73, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 291</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:13:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 13, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:49:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 49, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:49:11" default="NO">6, 49, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 22, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. nom.</hi> cupressi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 370</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> cupressos, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:15:1:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 15, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 443</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 393</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11971.1" n="B" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cypărissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a youth changed to a cypress</hi>, Ov M. 10, 121 sq.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11971.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a box of cypress wood; abl.</hi> cupresso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 332</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cupreus: <entryFree id="n11972" type="main" key="cu_^pre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^prĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^pr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuprum</etym>, <sense id="n11972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of copper, copper-</hi>: bidentes, Pall. <pb n="500" /> <cb n="CUR" /> Jul. 5: acus, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 37, § 74</bibl>, v. Cyprius, s. v. Cyprus).</sense></entryFree>
cuprinus: <entryFree id="n11973" type="main" key="cu_^pri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^prĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^pr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cuprum</etym>, <sense id="n11973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of copper, copper-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauterium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 14, 3 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cuprum: <entryFree id="n11974" type="main" key="cu_^prum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^prum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. Cyprus, II. A.</entryFree>
cupula: <entryFree id="n11975" type="main" key="cu_pu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. cupa</etym>, <sense id="n11975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cask</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11975.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small burying-vault</hi>: Renier, Inscr. Afric. 3373; 3584 al.—Sync. form CVPLA, Inscr. Afric. 3172.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11976" type="hapax" key="cu_pu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. cupa</etym>, <sense id="n11976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small, crooked handle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cur: <entryFree id="n11977" type="main" key="cu_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūr</orth> (old orthog. <orth extent="full" lang="la">quor</orth>; cf. Vel. Long. p. 2236 P.; and in MSS. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">cor</orth>, v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 171 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 171 sq.</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from quare; cf. Vel. Long. p. 2231 P. and the letter C; acc. to Voss, Etym. s. h. v.; Analog. 4, 21, and Hand, Turs. II. p. 175, from cui rei; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 33</bibl></cit></etym>, = quam ob rem, <sense id="n11977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for what reason, wherefore, why, to what purpose, from what motive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11977.1" n="I" level="1"> Rel.: <cit><quote lang="la">duae causae sunt, cur tu frequentior in isto officio esse debeas quam nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">causae, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ea causa, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit causa, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 61, 169</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">causa non esset, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa nulla est, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est causae, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa est, cur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est causae, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negare et adferre rationem cur negarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id satis magnum esse argumentum dixisti, cur esse deos confiteremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 62</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so after argumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est vero cur quis Junonem laedere nolit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 518</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with a negative: neque est, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen est, cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 144</bibl></cit>.- -And in dependent questions: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, cur tu in isto loco sedeas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 53, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 12</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui sit vestrum mirum, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miror, cur me accusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 20, 49</bibl> (v. miror, admiror, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">quā in re primum illud reprehendo et accuso, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:7:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me saepe accusas, cur hunc meum casum tam graviter feram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>;
