<bibl default="NO">3, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules invasit, cur silerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11977.2" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., = cujus causā, propter quod, <hi rend="ital">on account of which, by reason of which</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo accidit, cur consilium mutarem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid obstat, cur non verae fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerit aliquid Philippus, cur adversus eum ... hoc decerneremus: quid Perseus meruit... cur soli omnium hostes ei simus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caedicius negare, se commissurum, cur sibi ... quisquam imperium finiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 46, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Aristides commisisset, cur tantā poenā dignus duceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa quidem dixi, cur excusatus abirem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11977.3" n="II" level="1"> Interrog.: <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Quor mi haec irata est? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Quor haec irata est tibi? Quor ego id curem? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:143 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 143 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor perdis adulescentem nobis? quor amat? Quor potat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 36 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agis? quor te is perditum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor non introëo in nostram domum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 253</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum tan dem, aut cur ista quaeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Jube tibi agnum huc adferri propere pinguem. <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Quor? <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Ut sacrufices, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 82</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Non possum. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quor non? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ego plebeios magistratus ... video, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 15, 12</bibl>.—In the poets sometimes placed after one or more words of a clause: <cit><quote lang="la">stratege noster, quor hic cessat cantharus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium ventris mihi perniciosius est cur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 187</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11977.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n11977.5" n="1" level="3"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n11977.6" n="a" level="4"> Implying censure, indignation, remonstrance, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quor id aussu's facere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur es ausus subigitare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego? quor me excrucio? quor me macero?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur imperium illi, aut cur illo modo prorogatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 30, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur me querelis exanimas tuis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11977.7" n="b" level="4"> Implying grief, sorrow, and, with negatives, desire, etc.: eheu <cb n="CURA" /> me miserum, quor non aut istaec mihi Aetas et formast, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu me miserum, cur senatum cogor reprehendere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ego tecum non sum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11977.8" n="c" level="4"> With potential <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, in excusing, deprecating censure, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quor ego apud te mentiar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur hunc tam temere quisquam ab officio discessurum judicaret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: pro urbis salute, cur non omnibus facultatibus, quas habemus, utamur, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:68 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29, 68 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11977.9" n="2" level="3"> Emphatic after si, cum, etc., implying a logical conclusion: <cit><quote lang="la">tum id si falsum fuerat, filius quor non refellit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam, si res publica defenditur, cur ea consule isto ipso defensa non est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fac esse distentam ... cur tam multos deos nihil agere patitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur autem quidquam ignoraret animus hominis, si esset deus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:257" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 257</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11977.10" n="3" level="3"> Strengthened by particles of inference: nam, enim, igitur, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Pestis te tenet. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Nam quor istuc Dicis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cur me miseram verberas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor simulas igitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur enim, inquies, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>; v. Hand, Turs. II. pp. 175- 183.</sense></entryFree>
cura: <entryFree id="n11978" type="main" key="cu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caveo; cf. curo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n11978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">care, solicitude, carefulness, thought, concern</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11978.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Trouble</hi> (physical or mental), <hi rend="ital">bestowed on something; solicitude, care, attention, pains</hi> (syn.: diligentia, opera, studium, labor, etc.; opp. neglegentia, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>; very freq. in every per. and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11978.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11978.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11978.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ab. sol.</hi>: curantes magnā cum curā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā cum curā ego illum curari volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquā re curam ponere (just before: magnum studi um multamque operam, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tam acrem curam diligentiamque desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 184</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si utrumque cum curā et studio fecerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cum curā exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus laboris et curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 13; <cit><quote lang="la">so with labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:10 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 10 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura et industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in rem publicam omni cogitatione curāque incumberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with cogitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. neglegentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO">11, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non naturam defecisse sed curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:5" default="NO">2, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni curā vestigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni curā in aliquid incumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem curam in siderum cognitione ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura et meditatio accessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo majore curā illam (rem publicam) administrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re unā consumere curam (for which, in foll. verse, laborare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit> et saep.: esse cura alicui, <hi rend="ital">to be an object of one's care</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura pii diis sunt et qui coluere coluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 724</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen., care, attention, management, administration, charge, a guardianship, concern</hi> for a person or thing, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilis rerum alienarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum domesticarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeris sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: magni Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11978.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis cura de re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocum mihi conjuncta cura de publicā re et privatā fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua de Pompejo nostro tuendo ... cura te attigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11, 2</bibl></cit>, A: <cit><quote lang="la">gratissima est mihi tua cura de illo mandato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam habere, agere, etc.: de vitā communi omnium curam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani tamquam de Samnitibus non de se curam agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium non tam pro Aetolis cura erat, quam ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam habere pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam pro nobis hospitis, uxor, agas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 302.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Curae (alicui) esse, <hi rend="ital">to be an object of care</hi> or <cb n="CURA" /> <hi rend="ital">attention; to have a care for, take care of, attend to, to be anxious about, bestow pains upon</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar pollicitus est, sibi eam rem curae futuram, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sibi esse curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rati sese diis curae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui salus mea fuit curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 45</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea tantae mihi curae sunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicetur sibi magnae curae fore, ut omnia restituerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi curae Quantae conveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis doctoribus hoc esse curae velim, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque amor est curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum magis vis morbi ingravescens curae erat, terroresque ac prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum eo tempore minus ea bella ... curae patribus erant, quam expectatio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eorum periculis non secus absentes quam praesentes amicos Attico esse curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulli, quibus non fuit curae caelestem inveterare aquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:74" default="NO">9, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eligere modo curae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi erit curae explorare provinciae voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: de mandatis quod tibi curae fuit, est mihi gratum, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic recipiunt, Caesari ... de augendā meā dignitate curae fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 1</bibl>, and II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> infra: <cit><quote lang="la">de ceteris senatui curae fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the same sense also, (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Curae aliquid habere: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortatus, ut petitionem suam curae haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. § 16: habebo itaque curae, ut te meliorem reddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ille ... quid ageret, curae sibi haberet certiorem facere Atticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Cura est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause, solicitude, care, anxiety</hi> to do any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">curaque finitimos vincere major erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis amor teneat, nec sit mihi cura mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura comere capillum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., t. t. </sense><sense id="n11978.9" n="a" level="4"> In political lang. (esp. of the post-Aug. per.), <hi rend="ital">the management of state affairs, administration, charge, oversight, command, office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus et imperia, postremo omnis cura rerum publicarum minime mihi hac tempestate cupiunda videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">legionis armandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum publicorum, viarum, aquarum, etc. (preceded by nova officia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 37 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n11978.10" n="b" level="4"> In the jurists, <hi rend="ital">the management of business for a minor, guardianship, trusteeship</hi> (for the more usu. curatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:19" default="NO">5, 1, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11978.11" n="c" level="4"> In medic., <hi rend="ital">medical attendance, healing</hi> (for curatio), <hi rend="ital">cure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae, quae sub cutem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:551" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 551</bibl> Drak. et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae aegrescentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa fuit lacrimis ultima cura meis (sc. somnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11978.12" n="d" level="4"> In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">care, culture, rearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelusiacae lentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.). </sense><sense id="n11978.14" n="1" level="3"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mele/th</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a written work, writing</hi> (several times in Tac.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): quorum in manus cura nostra venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 39</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An attendant, guardian, overseer</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tertius immundae cura fidelis harae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the swine - herd Eumæus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: praetorii, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.16" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Anxiety, solicitude, concern, disquiet, trouble, grief, sorrow;</hi> syn.: sollicitudo, metus, etc.; cf. <foreign lang="greek">fronti/s</foreign> (very freq. in every per. and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11978.17" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: si quid ego adjuro curamve levasso, quae nunc te coquit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus lassus, curā confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidianā curā angere ani mum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae metusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: cura et sollicitudo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 20; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 1, 44 et saep.: curas cordis manis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres cuppedinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi saucia curā (Dido),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra, Hor C. 3, 1, 40: edaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine curā esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid facerem, curā cruciabar miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura est, negoti quid sit aut quid nuntiet,</quote> <trans><tr>I am anxious, my concern is</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: amica mea quid agat, Cura est, ut valeat, id. Stich. <pb n="501" /> <cb n="CURA" /> 5, 2, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi maximae curae est, non de meā quidem vitā, sed me patria sollicitat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam pro me curam geris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 48</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā in posterum curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 55</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur eam rem tam studiose curas, quae tibi multas dabit curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tibi curarum milia quanta dabit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11978.18" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the care, pain</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">anxiety of love, love</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">crescit enim assidue spectando cura puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 3; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 311</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua sub nostro pectore cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et juvenum curas et libera vina referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 85</bibl></cit>: hinc illaec primum Veneris dulcedinis in cor Stillavit gutta et successit frigida cura, <hi rend="ital">chilling anxiety</hi> for one loved, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1060" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1060</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11978.19" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">the loved object, the mistress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua cura, Lycoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 25, 1; 2 (3), 34, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 75</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, mea maxima cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 678</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raucae, tua cura, palumbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 57</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
curabilis: <entryFree id="n11979" type="main" key="cu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curo</etym>, <sense id="n11979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is to be apprehended</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 21</bibl></cit> dub.—</sense><sense id="n11979.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Curable</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanabilis, medicabilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:7:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 7, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curagendarius: <entryFree id="n11980" type="hapax" key="cu_ra^genda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrăgendārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cura, I. A. 2. b., -ago</etym>, <sense id="n11980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manager, overseer</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 29, 1.</sense></entryFree>
curalium: <entryFree id="n11981" type="main" key="cu_^ra_^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^rā^lĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. coralium.</entryFree>
curandus: <entryFree id="n11982" type="main" key="cu_randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrandus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. curo, II. B. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
curans: <entryFree id="n11983" type="main" key="cu_rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. curo, II. B. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
curate: <entryFree id="n11984" type="main" key="cu_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. curo, <sense id="n11984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
curatio: <entryFree id="n11985" type="main" key="cu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curo</etym>, <sense id="n11985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking care of something, administration, oversight, care, management, charge</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n11985.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">me sinas curare ancillas, quae mea est curatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus et curatio corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curatio et administratio rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:25:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: quid tibi hanc curatiost rem? (for hujus rei; cf. aditio) <hi rend="ital">why does this trouble you?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi, malum, me, aut quid ego agam, curatio'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11985.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., t. t. </sense><sense id="n11985.3" n="A" level="2"> In political lang., <hi rend="ital">management of state affairs, administration, charge, office</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 27, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11985.4" n="B" level="2"> In the jurists, <hi rend="ital">guardianship, trusteeship</hi>: qui in curatione sunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">words</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:10:4" default="NO">27, 10, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11985.5" n="C" level="2"> In medic., <hi rend="ital">healing, cure</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:18" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:9:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 9, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curationes aeger obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curator: <entryFree id="n11986" type="main" key="cu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātor</orth> (old orthog. COERATOR, <sense id="n11986.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">he who cares for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">takes charge of a thing, a manager, overseer, superintendent, keeper</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11986.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suntoque aediles coeratores urbis annonae ludorumque solemnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae Flaminiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviarii,</quote> <trans><tr>a bird-keeper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonini gregis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and gallinarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidus negotiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munerum ac venationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituendae Campaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituendi Capitolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">muris reficiendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus agrariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curator, qui statuis faciundis praeesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11986.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., a legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">a guardian, curator, trustee</hi> (of a minor, an imbecile, an absent person, etc.), Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 200</bibl>; Dig. libb. 26 et 27; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 11</bibl>; Jul. Cap. Vit. M. Aur. 10 et saep.; v. Dict. of Antiq.</sense></entryFree>
curatoria: <entryFree id="n11987" type="main" key="cu_ra_to_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curatorius</etym>, <sense id="n11987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">guardianship</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)pitroph/</foreign>, several times in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 1</bibl> and 2, always written as Greek, <foreign lang="greek">kouratori/a</foreign>, etc.</sense></entryFree>
curatoricius: <entryFree id="n11988" type="main" key="cu_ra_to_ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātōrīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curator, I.</etym>, <sense id="n11988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an overseer</hi>: equi, <hi rend="ital">the horses of a provincial commissary</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 29.</sense></entryFree>
curatorius: <entryFree id="n11989" type="main" key="cu_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curator, II.</etym>, <cb n="CURI" /> <sense id="n11989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to guardianship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">STIPENDIA VETERANORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4968</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11989.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a guardian</hi>: nomen, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curatrix: <entryFree id="n11990" type="gloss" key="cu_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātrix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n11990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female guardian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 150, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curatura: <entryFree id="n11991" type="hapax" key="cu_ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curo</etym>, <sense id="n11991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">management, care, attendance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 25</bibl> Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
curatus: <entryFree id="n11992" type="main" key="cu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, of curo.</entryFree>
curculio: <entryFree id="n11993" type="main" key="curcu^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curcŭlĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">gurgŭlĭo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 9</bibl> Ritschl, Fleck.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jun. 3</bibl>; also in some MSS. of the authors cited infra), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with circulus, circus</etym>, <sense id="n11993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corn-worm, weevil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:15 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 73, § 302</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 186</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11993.1" n="B" level="2"> Form gurgulio = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:38" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11993.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Curcŭlĭo</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy of Plautus</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
curculiunculus: <entryFree id="n11994" type="hapax" key="curcu^li^uncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curcŭlĭuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>curculio</etym>, <sense id="n11994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little weevil</hi>, in comic lang. for <hi rend="ital">something trifling, worthless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 38</bibl> (v. the passage in connection).</sense></entryFree>
cures: <entryFree id="n11995" type="main" key="Cu^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (parvi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:135" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 135</bibl>) and <gen>f.</gen> (Tatiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:9:74" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 9, 74</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/reis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*ku/ris</foreign> [curis, Sabine word, = hasta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 477</bibl>], <sense id="n11995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ancient chief town of the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 51</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 811</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:778 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 778 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>; cf. Quirites.—</sense><sense id="n11995.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:201" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11995.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭren-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 94</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11995.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 68</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11995.4" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrētis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (or perh. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭres</orth>, ētis), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Cures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 9.</sense></entryFree>
curetes: <entryFree id="n11996" type="main" key="Cu_re_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kourh=tes</foreign>, <sense id="n11996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the most ancient inhabitants of the island of Crete, who paid their worship to Jupiter</hi> (as the Corybantes, who, at a later date, were identified with them, celebrated the worship of Cybele) <hi rend="ital">with noisy music and armed dances</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 139" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 629</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 131</bibl> Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 282</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1877" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1877</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 46 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11996.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n11996.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, lit. <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Curetes;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 153</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst., an earlier name of the island of Crete itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 58</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">of Acarnania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:308" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 308</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11996.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrētĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:96" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curetis: <entryFree id="n11997" type="main" key="Cu^re_tis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrētis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Cures, III.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11998" type="main" key="Cu_re_tis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Curetes, II. A.</entryFree>
curia: <entryFree id="n11999" type="main" key="cu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Quiris, Quirites; cf. the letter C</etym>, <sense id="n11999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a curia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">court, one of the thirty parts into which Romulus divided the Roman people, ten for each of the three tribes; each curia contained ten</hi> gentes, Varr. ap. Dion. Hal. 2, 83; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 1</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n11999.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11999.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A structure built for the religious services of a curia</hi> (sometimes also serving for other purposes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174, 6</bibl> ib.: veteres, on the east side of the Palatine Hill, Varr. l. l. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called curia prisca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 140</bibl></cit>; Fest. l. l.: Novae, id. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n11999.3" n="2" level="3"> Hence, dies curiae, <hi rend="ital">a festival day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7</bibl>. 27.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11999.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One of the edifices in which the Senate held its consultations</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11999.5" n="1" level="3"> Commonly <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, the Curia Hostilia built by Tullus Hostilius (in reference to the later Curia Julia and Pompeiana, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">the Curia, Senate-house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 46</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 57, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 802</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11999.6" n="2" level="3"> Curia Julia, <hi rend="ital">the Senate-house begun by Julius Cæsar, finished by the triumvirs, and used by the Senate after the burning of the</hi> Curia Hostilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11999.7" n="3" level="3"> Curia Pompeji or Pompeja, <hi rend="ital">the Senate-house built by Pompey, finally closed after the assassination of Julius Cæsar in it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80 sq.</bibl> et saep.—Hence, trop., as emblem of law: <cit><quote lang="la">stante urbe et curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro curia inversique mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the senatorial rank: curia pauperibus clausa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11999.8" n="C" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">the places of assembly</hi> <cb n="CURI" /> <hi rend="ital">of high councils</hi> out of Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11999.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The assembly of the Senate, the Senate</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">a curiā nulla me res divellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in curiam introducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23, 11</bibl> sq.; 2, 24, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 14</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11999.10" n="E" level="2"> Curia Calabra, so called from the proclamation of the dates which was there made; v. Calabra.—</sense><sense id="n11999.11" n="F" level="1"> Curia Saliorum, <hi rend="ital">the official building of the Salii on the Palatine Hill, consecrated to Mars, in which the sacred lituus was kept</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curiales: <entryFree id="n12000" type="gloss" key="curia_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curiāles</orth> <itype>mensae, in quibus immolabatur Junoni, quae curis appellata est</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
curialis: <entryFree id="n12001" type="main" key="cu_ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curia</etym>, <sense id="n12001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a curia</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n12001.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging to the same curia, district</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">division of the people; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the same curia</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">dhmo/ths</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quisquam curialium Venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimonem etiam in suos curialis hospitalem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 13</bibl> Müll.: curiales ejusdem curiae ut tribules et municipes.—</sense><sense id="n12001.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the religious services of the curiœ</hi>: curiales flamines curiarum sacerdotes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 1</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n12001.3" n="III" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">belonging to the imperial court</hi>, = aulicus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:10" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:10:41" default="NO">10, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curianus: <entryFree id="n12002" type="main" key="Cu^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Curius, II.</entryFree>
curiatii: <entryFree id="n12003" type="main" key="Cu_ri^a_ti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrĭātĭi</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrĭi</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl>, or 4, 2, 7 Müll.), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Albanian</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">subsequently transplanted to Rome</hi>, from which were descended the three Curiatii who fell in the contest with the Roman Horatii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:26:78 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 26, 78 al.</bibl>: cecini Curios fratres, Prop. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
curiatim: <entryFree id="n12004" type="main" key="cu_ri^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>curia</etym>, <sense id="n12004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by curiæ</hi> (very rare): populum consuluit, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 2</bibl>, the better read. is curiatum).</sense></entryFree>
curiatius: <entryFree id="n12005" type="main" key="Curiatius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Curiatius</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: Curiatius Maternus, v. Maternus.</sense></entryFree>
curiatus: <entryFree id="n12006" type="main" key="cu_ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curia</etym>, <sense id="n12006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the curiæ</hi>: comitia, <hi rend="ital">in which the people voted according to curiæ</hi> (orig. the only ruling assembly; later limited by the comitia centuriata to cases of arrogation (adoption), the choice of priests, the conferring of the chief command; cf. comitium, II.; Dict. of Antiq.), Lael. Felix ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 26 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>passed in such comitia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 28</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:11" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 46, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 6</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
curidius: <entryFree id="n12007" type="main" key="Curidius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Curidius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curietae: <entryFree id="n12008" type="main" key="Cu_rietae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrietae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Curieta, an island on the coast of Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Veglia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 139</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrietĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Curieta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curii: <entryFree id="n12009" type="main" key="Cu^ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Curiatii <sense id="n12009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
curio: <entryFree id="n12010" type="main" key="cu_ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>curia</etym>. <sense id="n12010.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The priest of a curia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:6:section=46" default="NO">6, § 46</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">maximus,</quote> <trans><tr>he who presided over all the curiæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126, 17</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n12010.1" n="II" level="1"> Post-Aug., <hi rend="ital">a crier, herald</hi>, = praeco, Mart. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:2 praef" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2 praef.</bibl>; Treb. Gall. 12.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12011" type="main" key="Cu_ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Scribonia; v. Scribonius; hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cū-rĭōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Curio</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12012" type="hapax" key="cu_ri^o3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cura</etym> (a humorously-formed word, corresp. with curiosus), <sense id="n12012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wasted by sorrow, lean, emaciated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 27 sq.</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection); cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=60:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 60, 3</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
curionatus: <entryFree id="n12013" type="hapax" key="cu_ri^o_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. curio, I.</etym>, <sense id="n12013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of priest of a curia</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 9</bibl> Müll. (cf. curionius).</sense></entryFree>
curionianus: <entryFree id="n12014" type="main" key="Cu_ri^o_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrĭōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Curio.</entryFree>
curionius: <entryFree id="n12015" type="gloss" key="cu_ri^o_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. curio, I.</etym>, <sense id="n12015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the priest of a curia</hi>: curionium aes dicebatur quod dabatur curioni ob sacerdotium curionatus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 19</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">curionia sacra, quae in curiis fiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 62, 11.</sense></entryFree>
curiose: <entryFree id="n12016" type="main" key="cu_ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. curiosus <sense id="n12016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
curiositas: <entryFree id="n12017" type="main" key="cu_ri^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curiosus</etym>, <sense id="n12017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desire of knowledge, curiosity, inquisitiveness</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeret. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 25</bibl>. <pb n="502" /> <cb n="CURI" /></sense></entryFree>
curiosolites: <entryFree id="n12018" type="main" key="Cu_ri^o^so^li_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cūrĭŏsŏlītes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe in Armorica</hi> (Gall. Lugdun.), <hi rend="ital">near the mod. Corseult, south of St. Malo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Curiosolitas, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl>; 3, 7; 3, 11 al. —The same called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cārĭosvĕlītes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curiosulus: <entryFree id="n12019" type="hapax" key="cu_ri^o_su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōsŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [curiosus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat curious, a little inquisitive;</hi> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curiosus: <entryFree id="n12020" type="main" key="cu_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cura</etym>. <sense id="n12020.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to cura, I.) <hi rend="ital">Bestowing care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pains upon a thing, applying one's self assiduously, careful, diligent, thoughtful, devoted</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12020.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12020.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni historiā curiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me nihilo minus nosti curiosum in re publicā quam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad investigandum curiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12020.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 20" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiosissimus famae suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Philos. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12020.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">circa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa uxoris pudicitiam minus curiosus fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12020.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quidem doctus, sed curiosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pictor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas Horatii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 118, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpolatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:75 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 75 al.</bibl></cit> —* </sense><sense id="n12020.6" n="2" level="3"> With the access. idea of excess, <hi rend="ital">too eager</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam supervacua (ut sic dixerim) operositas, ut a diligenti curiosus et a religione superstitio distat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12020.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">inquiring eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anxiously about a thing, inquiring into</hi>, in a good or bad sense; <hi rend="ital">curious, inquisitive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12020.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne curiosissimi quidem homines exquirendo audire tam multa possunt, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO">11, 3, 143</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:77 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 77 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiosis oculis perspici non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12020.9" n="2" level="3"> Implying censure ( = <foreign lang="greek">polupra/gmwn</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">meddlesome, officious, curious, prying, inquisitive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum patere me esse curiosum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl> Madv.; 1, 1, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 26, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quare ut homini curioso ita perscribe ad me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiosum aliquem extimescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae (basia) nec pernumerare curiosi Possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit> Ellis ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n12020.10" n="b" level="4"> Post-Aug., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, of one who is <hi rend="ital">prying, a spy, scout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiosum ac speculatorem ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>.—Later, <hi rend="ital">a class of secret spies, secret police, an informer</hi>, etc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12</bibl>, tit. 23: De Curiosis et Stationariis al.—</sense><sense id="n12020.11" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to cura, II.) <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that injures himself by care;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">emaciated, wasted, lean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 26</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection); cf.: nempe ille vivit carie curiosior, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 28</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 250 Rib.).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭŏsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n12020.12" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.
