A.) <hi rend="ital">With care, carefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">involvendus vestimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12020.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Too nicely, carefully</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiose potius quam Latine loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12020.14" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Inquisitively, curiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquirerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiosius conquiram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertunt ea, quae domi fiunt (pueri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curis: <entryFree id="n12021" type="main" key="cu^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quĭris</orth>, <itype>ītis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sabine</etym>, <sense id="n12021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 477</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9, 16</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 10</bibl> Müll.; v. Quirites.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrītis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Quĭrītis</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Juno as protector of spearmen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1303 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8659</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curito: <entryFree id="n12022" type="main" key="cu_ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>curo</etym>, <sense id="n12022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take care of, to cherish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curius: <entryFree id="n12023" type="hapax" key="cu_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cura, II.</etym>, <sense id="n12023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sorrow, grievous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infortunio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 44</bibl></cit> dub. (Ritschl, curvo).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12024" type="main" key="Cu^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n12024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">thus M'. Curius Dentatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the conqueror of the Samnites, Sabines, Lucanians, and of Pyrrhus; celebrated for his moderation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:55 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 55 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 33" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18" default="NO">1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 5 sq.</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12024.1" n="B" level="2"> Appel. for <hi rend="ital">a bold and moderate man;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nenia) et maribus Curiis et decantata Camillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12024.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Curius</hi>, <cb n="CURO" /> <hi rend="ital">Curian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curo: <entryFree id="n12025" type="main" key="cu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūro</orth> (old orthog. COERO and COIRO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">560</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">570</bibl>: <sense id="n12025.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">coeret, coerari, coerandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>), āvi, ātum, 1 (<hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> curassis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 50</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> curarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 79</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cura</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to care for, take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have care of, to be solicitous for, to look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attend to, trouble one's self about</hi>, etc. (very freq. in every period and species of composition); constr. with the <case>acc.</case>, the <case>acc.</case> with the <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut, ne</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">simple subj.</hi>, the <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12025.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12025.2" n="1" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n12025.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curare omnia studiosissime ac diligentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diligenter praeceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna di curant, parva neglegunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 17, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opsonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <trans><tr>to cleanse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta curare et polire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 12</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense, cadaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii jussi corpus Alexandri suo more curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; in other connections, curare corpus means <hi rend="ital">to nourish, take care of one's self, to refresh, invigorate one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:937" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 937</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc corpora curare tempus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 48, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:22 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 22 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelliculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se suamque aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; and in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curati cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes vinoque et cibo curatos domos dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: vineam, <hi rend="ital">to tend</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 195</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">res rationesque eri,</quote> <trans><tr>to superintend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensa ac domos, of the women of the family,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociorum injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces (Diana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia,</quote> <trans><tr>to endeavor to avert, ward off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">munus te curaturum scio, Ut mittas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam mulsam prope ut sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te multum amamus, quod ea (signa) abs te diligenter parvoque curata sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>provided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">II. C. infra: ego illum cum curā magnā curabo tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit> and 9; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 121</bibl>: curatur a multis, timetur a pluribus, <hi rend="ital">is courted</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">qerapeu/ein</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 15</bibl> et saep.—With a negative: quos peperisti ne cures, <hi rend="ital">be unconcerned</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 656</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii, quasi corpus nullum sit hominis, ita praeter animum nihil curant,</quote> <trans><tr>care for nothing except the mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri nihil perjuria curant (with nihil metuere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego istuc curo, qui sit, unde sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 95</bibl></cit>: alia cura, a conversational expression (lit. trouble yourself about something else; <cit><quote lang="la">hence),</quote> <trans><tr>do not trouble yourself, never mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 55</bibl></cit> and 60; <cit><quote lang="la">and in like sense, aliud cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12025.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">gerundive, to cause something to be done, to order, to urge on</hi>, etc. (in good prose and very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">predominant in Cæsar): pontem in Arari faciundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides inter eos dandos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; 3, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 29 et saep.: buculam faciendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam mihi referendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem interficiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12025.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">part. perf pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventum tibi curabo et mecum adductum Tuom Pamphilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12025.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (most freq. with a negative): <cit><quote lang="la">ea nolui scribere, quae nec indocti intellegere possent, nec docti legere curarent,</quote> <trans><tr>would take the trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so negatively,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil Romae geritur, quod te putem scire curare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; 3, 8, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 370</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 682</bibl> et saep.—Affirmatively: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui sunt, qui illud curent defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istas res scire curavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mando tibi, uti cures lustrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice, si quid Et nos, quod cures proprium fecisse, loquamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">460</bibl> sq.; Suet. <cb n="CURO" /> Dom. 20; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero haec inter se congruere possent, ut natura et procreari vellet et diligi procreatos non curaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">symbolos proponi et saxis proscribi curat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:12" default="NO">3, 5, 12</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego capitis mei periculo patriam liberavi, vos liberi sine periculo esse non curatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 66</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut, ne</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">simple subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater curabit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:25 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 25 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fecisset, se curaturam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>.—So in concluding letters: cura ut valeas, <hi rend="ital">take care of yourself, be careful of your health</hi> (for which da operam ut valeas, fac valeas, et al. sim.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 15, 2</bibl>; 7, 20, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus cura et provide, ne quid ei desit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:24" default="NO">2, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illa quidem curo mihi scribas, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam curabo sentiat, quos attentarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curare uti Romae ne essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> (ante-and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illis curandum censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; so, omnibus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus meis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quod strabonus est, non curo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, quanto hoc diligentius curem quam aut de rumore aut de Pollione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">curasti probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Plant. Rud. 2, 3, 50: abi intro; <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic curabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quisque legatus aut tribunus curabat,</quote> <trans><tr>commanded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in postremo loco cum equitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12025.7" n="2" level="3"> Of things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa suscipienda curarit sollemnia sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vera virtus Curat reponi deterioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1015" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1015</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:231" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 231</bibl> Lachm.; with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ne miremur sopor atque oblivia curant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 826</bibl></cit> (822).—</sense><sense id="n12025.8" n="II" level="1"> In partic., t. t. </sense><sense id="n12025.9" n="A" level="2"> In state affairs, <hi rend="ital">to take the charge of, to manage the business of, to do a thing in behalf of the state, to administer, govern, preside over, command</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n12025.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum maritimum curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris Germaniae legiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus his artibus ... se remque publicam curabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12025.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Faesulanum in sinistrā parte curare jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo additi qui Romae curarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12025.12" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to heal, cure</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12025.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quod corpora curari possint, animorum medicina nulla sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes gravius aegrotant, tristius curantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem frigidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem radice vel herbā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 151</bibl></cit> et saep.: morbos, Cels. prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:22" default="NO">7, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 84</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">apparentia vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 10</bibl></cit>. —Rarely, <hi rend="ital">to operate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ferrum medici prius quam curetur aspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12025.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae pars, quae manu curat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:39 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 39 al.</bibl> —Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = medicus, <hi rend="ital">a physician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimi sub alterutro curantis errore moriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrandus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the patient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi festinare curandi imbecillitas cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12025.15" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (ironically): <cit><quote lang="la">cum provinciam curarit, sanguinem miserit, mihi tradiderit enectam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reduviam (corresp. with capiti mederi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12025.16" n="C" level="2"> In mercantile lang., <hi rend="ital">to take care of money matters, to adjust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settle, pay</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(nummos) pro signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam pro eo frumento legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidium pecuniae redemptori tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me cui jussisset curaturum,</quote> <trans><tr>that I would make payment according to his direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.). </sense><sense id="n12025.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Earnest, anxious</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">curatissimae preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: interim me <pb n="503" /> <cb n="CURR" /> quidam ... secreto curatoque sermone corripit, monet, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12025.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Taken care of, managed, attended to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves curatiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitida illa et curata vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully, diligently;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curatius disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curotrophoe: <entryFree id="n12026" type="greek" key="cu_ro^tro^phoe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūrŏtrŏphoe</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">kourotro/foi</foreign>, <sense id="n12026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishing children</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae ab alimoniā infantum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 10, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
currax: <entryFree id="n12027" type="main" key="currax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">currax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curro</etym>, <sense id="n12027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">running fast, quick, swift</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laquei,</quote> <trans><tr>which are bound on the feet of running animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curriculum: <entryFree id="n12028" type="main" key="curri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">currĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running, course, race</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12028.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conicere se in curriculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: pedes in curriculum conferre, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 263, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere unum curriculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita celeri curriculo fui propere a portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12028.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> curriculo adverb., <hi rend="ital">in a quick course, at full speed, swiftly, hastily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12028.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a running on a wager, a race</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">athletae se in curriculo exercentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:36 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 36 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12028.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12028.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A race-ground, course, career</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n12028.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: solis et lunae, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 198, 29</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n12028.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum nobis vitae curriculum natura circumscripsit, immensum gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendi a naturā datum conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curricula multiplicium variorumque sermonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex constituto spatio defensionis in semihorae curriculum coëgisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae sunt exercitationes ingenii, haec curricula mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 22, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne industriae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in quadrigis eum secundum numeraverim ... nec in oratoribus, qui tantum absit a primo, vix ut in eodem curriculo esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12028.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The time of the annual circuit of the sun, a year</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3 (al. 9), 11.—</sense><sense id="n12028.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A race-chariot</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 44</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12028.11" n="2" level="3"> For <hi rend="ital">a chariot</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equi turbati in amnem praecipitavere curricula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: Mettum Fufetium equis ad curriculum ex utrāque parte deligatum distraxit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 287, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
currilis: <entryFree id="n12029" type="main" key="curri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">currīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>currus</etym>, <sense id="n12029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for a chariot</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praesepia equorum currilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <trans><tr>chariot-races</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: currilis equus, <foreign lang="greek">su\n a(/rmati a)gwnizo/menos i(/ppos</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.; cf. also curulis.</sense></entryFree>
curro: <entryFree id="n12030" type="main" key="curro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curro</orth>, <itype>cŭcurri</itype> (old form cĕcurri, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 14</bibl>: curri, Varr. Imp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 2</bibl> Mai; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. in Pers. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 4</bibl>), <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>kindr. with celer, coruscus</etym>, <sense id="n12030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run, to move quickly</hi> (on foot, on a horse, ship, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to hasten, fly</hi> (very freq. in every period and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n12030.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12030.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">si ingrederis curre, si curris advola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totum conclave pavidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum loculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 26, 17 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostros toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 19), 10 et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad villam praecipitanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1063</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omne mare nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremos ad Indos mercator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">injecto ter pulvere curras (nauta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 36 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed neque currentem se nec cognoscit euntem,</quote> <trans><tr>his former strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vocem praeceps amensque cucurri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 844</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of distance: <cit><quote lang="la">uno die MCCCV. stadia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 20, § 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a figure: eosdem cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of flight: <cit><quote lang="la">medio ut limite curras, Icare, moneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 203</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illam (dextram) osculari non curreret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me curritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curritur ad praetorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo curratur celeriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 30 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12030.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Rarely <cb n="CURS" /> with the homogeneous objects iter, stadium, campus, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stadium currit,</quote> <trans><tr>who runs a race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currimus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 235</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 862</bibl>).—Hence <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: unde et campus curritur et mare navigatur, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12030.4" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: currentem incitare or instigare, etc., <hi rend="ital">to spur a willing horse</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to urge one who needs no urging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16, § 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius est currentem, ut aiunt, incitare quam commovere languentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt.: quod me hortaris ... currentem tu quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 45, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">currentem hortari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 7, 1: currenti calcaria addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellum currere doceas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you labor to no purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per flammam,</quote> <trans><tr>to go through fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12030.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate objects (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sol currens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 682</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of liquids: amnes in aequora currunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 524</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 607</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 597</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Hisp. 29 al.: currente rotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (chlamydem) circum Purpura cucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 250</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor per ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">linea per medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes per agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:108:112" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 108, 112</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">243 and 245: vox currit conchato parietum spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varius per ora cucurrit Ausonidum turbata fremor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina dulci modulatione currentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the eyes: oculi currentes, huc illucque directi et furiose respicientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 2, p. 281</bibl></cit> Garet.—</sense><sense id="n12030.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quo multa parum communis littera currat,</quote> <trans><tr>not but that they have many letters in common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclivi currit oratio, venit ad extremum, haeret in salebrā,</quote> <trans><tr>runs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia currere debet ac ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum debeant sublimia ingredi, acria currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rhythmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus incomposito pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currit ferox Aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>flies away, passes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12030.7" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">acc., to run, traverse</hi> (cf. I. b. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">eosdem cursus currere,</quote> <trans><tr>to adopt the same policy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia saecla, suis dixerunt, currite, fusis Concordes Parcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 46</bibl></cit> (al. regard saecla as <hi rend="ital">voc.;</hi> al. take currite as transitive, <hi rend="ital">produce such ages, cause them to be such, as ye run;</hi> cf. Forbig ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
currulis: <entryFree id="n12031" type="main" key="curru_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">currūlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>currus</etym>, <sense id="n12031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a chariot</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a chariot-race</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies equorum (post-class. and rare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus (opp. equester fremitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. 3</bibl></cit> Mai; cf. curulis.</sense></entryFree>
currus: <entryFree id="n12032" type="main" key="currus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">currus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>curro</etym>, <sense id="n12032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chariot, car, wain</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12032.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12032.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 642</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 819</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 21, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12032.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12032.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A triumphal car</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:22" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:252 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 252 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n12032.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a triumph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:89" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 9, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 316</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:345" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 345</bibl> Drak.—</sense><sense id="n12032.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A war-chariot</hi> ( = esseda), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12032.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. * </sense><sense id="n12032.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A ship, boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12032.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The horses drawing a chariot, a team, span</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:367" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 570</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n12032.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pair of small wheels by which the beam of a plough was supported and guided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus a tergo torquere imos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 174</bibl></cit> Forbig ad loc.; v. Heyne Exc. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
cursatio: <entryFree id="n12033" type="main" key="cursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curso</etym>, <sense id="n12033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi>, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cursilitas: <entryFree id="n12034" type="main" key="cursi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curro</etym>, <sense id="n12034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running about</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 3</bibl>; cf. Auct. Class. 3, p. 81 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
cursim: <entryFree id="n12035" type="main" key="cursim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quickly, swiftly, hastily, speedily</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 124</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cito et cursim est agendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapi ad carnuficem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmine acto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliena (opp. sensim dicere quod causae prodesset),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arripere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:89:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 89, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergere ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
cursio: <entryFree id="n12036" type="hapax" key="cursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 11</bibl> Müll. <cb n="CURS" /></sense></entryFree>
cursitatio: <entryFree id="n12037" type="hapax" key="cursi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cursito</etym>, <sense id="n12037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running about hither and thither</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 42, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cursito: <entryFree id="n12038" type="main" key="cursito"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursito</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [curso], <hi rend="ital">to run about, run hither and thither</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n12038.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: sursum deorsum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc et illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ad Celsum modo ad Nepotem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excalciatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12038.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12038.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To race, run races</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo Ladas aut Boius cum Sicyoniis cursitarint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12038.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the motion of atoms: <cit><quote lang="la">huc et illuc casu et temere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curso: <entryFree id="n12039" type="main" key="curso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [curro], <hi rend="ital">to run hither and thither, to and fro</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ultro et citro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit> Bentl. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per foros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnes vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:108" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 108</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursari rursum prorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12039.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to run over, traverse</hi>: nunc jam compactis cursanda syllaba est formis, Mart. Cap. poët. 3, § 262. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, instead of ni cursaturus, the right reading is incusaturus; Halm, Ritter, v. Orell. ad h. l.)</sense></entryFree>
cursor: <entryFree id="n12040" type="main" key="cursor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a runner</hi>, and partic., </sense><sense id="n12040.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A runner in a race, racer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">a competitor in a chariot-race</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cupidi cursor frena retentat equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12040.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A courier, post</hi> (mostly postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 3</bibl> (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(merodro/mos</foreign>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:100:1 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 100, 1 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n12040.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A slave who ran before the chariot of a grandee, a forerunner</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:123:7" default="NO">123, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 47, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12040.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursor iambus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Rhet. p. 355</bibl></cit> Capperon.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12041" type="main" key="Cursor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of L. Papirius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:18" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 31" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cursorius: <entryFree id="n12042" type="main" key="curso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a race-course</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n12042.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 141" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 141</bibl></cit> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n12042.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n12042.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cursōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. navis), <hi rend="ital">a yacht, cutter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12042.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cursōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = cursus publicus, <hi rend="ital">a public post, mail</hi>, Auct. Lim. p. 261 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
cursualis: <entryFree id="n12043" type="main" key="cursu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cursus</etym>, <sense id="n12043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a course, running</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <trans><tr>post-horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 19</bibl></cit>: raeda, <hi rend="ital">a stage-coach</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 12, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>speed in running</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 29, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12043.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hasty, speedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cursura: <entryFree id="n12044" type="main" key="cursu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curro</etym>, <sense id="n12044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cursus: <entryFree id="n12045" type="main" key="cursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi> (<hi rend="ital">on foot, on a horse, chariot, ship</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a course, way, march, passage, voyage, journey</hi>, etc. (very freq.). </sense><sense id="n12045.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12045.2" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus, cursus, accubitio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cursu, luctando ... sese exercebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 73</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 412</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique pedum cursu valet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu superare canem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites cursu exanimati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc magno cursu intenderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>at full speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno cursu concitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu incitatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>; 3, 46; Auct. B. Alex. 20; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cursu esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> infra: <cit><quote lang="la">strictis gladiis cursu in hostem feruntur,</quote> <trans><tr>advance at a run</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effuso cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo cursu proripere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 26, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo cursu, Auct. B. Alex 30: eodem cursu contendere,</quote> <trans><tr>right onward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 67</bibl>: citato cursu. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus in Graeciam per tuam provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam tam brevi tempore tot loca adire, tantos cursus conficere potuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terrae) tuis non dicam cursibus, sed victoriis lustratae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen cursūs magis quam itineris modo ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:12" default="NO">6, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:8:2" default="NO">11, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miltiades cursum direxit, quo tendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:1" default="NO">1, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixi per mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterare cursus relictos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naxon, ait Liber, cursus advertite vestros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 636</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. B.: cursum per <pb n="504" /> <cb n="CURT" /> auras Derigere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 194</bibl>; so of <hi rend="ital">flying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 838</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 787 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12045.3" n="b" level="4"> Cursum tenere (in a march or on shipboard), <hi rend="ital">to hold one's course, to maintain a direct course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites cursum tenere atque insulam capere non potuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius cum secundissimo vento cursum teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl>; cf. 2. b. —</sense><sense id="n12045.4" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">solis cursus lunaeque meatus Expediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:772 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 772 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 629</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 630</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque clara suo percurrere fulmina cursu Perpetuo possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1003" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1003</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lacus emissus lapsu et cursu suo ad mare profluxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">the course</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow of a stream</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 282</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longarum navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
