G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilonis et Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 688</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 302</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">menstrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadripertiti venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 195</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12045.5" n="b" level="4"> Cursum tenere, as supra, 1. b.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta tempestas subito coorta est, ut nulla earum (navium) cursum tenere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12045.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12045.7" n="1" level="3"> Cursum exspectare, <hi rend="ital">to wait for a fair wind</hi> (lit. <hi rend="ital">for a passage</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12045.8" n="2" level="3"> (Abstr. pro concr.) Cursus publici, in the time of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">posts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relays divided into stations, for the speedy transmission of information upon state affairs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3181</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3329</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">. equi publici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehicula publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus vehicularius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. P. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehicularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus fiscalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 7</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12045.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. in Cic. and Quint.), <hi rend="ital">a course, progress, direction, way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cursus rerum, qui exitus futurus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicari aliquo certo genere cursuque vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae brevis cursus, gloriae sempiternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquus vitae cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius vitae cursum videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem vitae suae cursum conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni vitae cursu optimum visum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuorum honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 27 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus vocis per omnis sonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">the motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow of discourse</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 15, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 27; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 4, 70: cursus hic et sonus rotundae volubilisque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem enim cursum industria mea tenere potuisset sine forensibus causis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in eodem cursu fuimus a Sullā dictatore ad eosdem fere consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 328</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">esse in cursu,</quote> <trans><tr>to go on, continue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 508</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:362" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 362</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curtilius: <entryFree id="n12046" type="main" key="Curti^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Curtĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
curtius: <entryFree id="n12047" type="main" key="Curti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Curtĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n12047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n12047.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Curtius Postumus, <hi rend="ital">a partisan of Cæsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl>, a, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12047.2" n="II" level="1"> Q. Curtius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">the historiographer of Alexander the Great</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12047.3" n="III" level="1"> Curtius Nicia, <hi rend="ital">of Cos, freedman of a Curtius, a friend of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12047.4" n="IV" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n12047.5" n="A" level="2"> Lacus Curtius, <hi rend="ital">a place in Rome named after a certain Curtius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=148" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 148</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl>; Ov F. 6, 403; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Lacus Curtii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 8</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n12047.6" n="B" level="2"> Curtius Fons, <hi rend="ital">a fountain</hi>, forty Roman miles from Rome, whose waters were conducted thither by Caligula, a part of the Aqua Claudia (v. Claudius, II. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 13 sq" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also CVRTIA AQVA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curto: <entryFree id="n12048" type="main" key="curto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>curtus</etym>, <sense id="n12048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shorten, diminish</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Feb. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12048.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:34" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quantulum enim summae curtabit quisque dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curtus: <entryFree id="n12049" type="main" key="curtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. kart, to cut; cf. Germ. kurz</etym>, <sense id="n12049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shortened, mutilated, broken, short</hi> (class.; most freq. in the poets). </sense><sense id="n12049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: dolia, <hi rend="ital">pots</hi> (chamber vessels), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1026" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1026</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:271" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 70: <cit><quote lang="la">testa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">testu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:645 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 645 al.</bibl></cit>. calix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1</bibl>, <cb n="CURV" /> 92, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">curtum temone jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>circumcised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>castrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 20; but curto mulo, <hi rend="ital">with shortened tail</hi> ( = curtatā caudā), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 104</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12049.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 64</bibl></cit> (cf. curto, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">centussis,</quote> <trans><tr>a clipped piece</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:191" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia quasi curta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides ingratae patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:166 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 166 al.</bibl></cit>— Of <hi rend="ital">defective, incomplete</hi> discourse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 50, 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51, 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curulis: <entryFree id="n12050" type="main" key="cu^ru_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭrūlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">curr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>currus</etym>, <sense id="n12050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a chariot</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12050.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <trans><tr>the four horses provided at the public cost for the games of the circus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=49:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 49, 14</bibl> Müll.; Cod. Th. 15, 5, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 10, 1: ludi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: triumphus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">upon a chariot</hi> (in opp. to an ovatio, on horseback or on foot), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl>: Juno curulis, in an ancient form of prayer in <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12050.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: sella curulis, <hi rend="ital">the curule chair, official chair</hi>, adopted from the Etruscans, and inlaid with ivory; used by the consuls, praetors, and curule ediles, who hence received their name (v. aedilis, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 11, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 46, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 52, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 29 al.</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭrūlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:59:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:488" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 488</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:115" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:18 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 18 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">major curulis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:82" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 82</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12050.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the honor of a</hi> sella curulis, <hi rend="ital">curule</hi>: aedilis, L. Pis. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl> and 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:131 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 131 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aedilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 13, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur ( = sella curulis),</quote> <trans><tr>consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. magistratus, Gab. Bass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 18</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭrūlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = aedilis curulis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and curules,</quote> <trans><tr>the curule magistracies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curvabilis: <entryFree id="n12051" type="hapax" key="curva_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>curvo</etym>, <sense id="n12051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be bent, flexible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus et fraxinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curvamen: <entryFree id="n12052" type="main" key="curva_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending, bend, vaulting</hi> (not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. first used by Ov.): patriae curvamina ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 450</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 672</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (villa) unum sinum molli curvamine amplectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>of the climate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curvatio: <entryFree id="n12053" type="main" key="curva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curvatura: <entryFree id="n12054" type="main" key="curva_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending, rounding, bend</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n12054.1" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 14, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 19, 21, § 42 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12054.2" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">camerae,</quote> <trans><tr>an arched ceiling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
curvesco: <entryFree id="n12055" type="main" key="curvesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be crooked, curved, to make a curve</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mare curvescens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 9, 9</bibl>; id. de Isaac et An. 7, 60; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 118, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curvitas: <entryFree id="n12056" type="hapax" key="curvi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>curvus</etym>, <sense id="n12056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crookedness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
curvo: <entryFree id="n12057" type="main" key="curvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crook, bend, bow, curve</hi> (not ante-Aug.; v. Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n12057.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvari manus et aduncos crescere in ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bimā cornua fronte (vitulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 441</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">flexile cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 383</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 324</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem arcum manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotundas Curvat aper lances,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by its weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calabros sinus (Hadria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 33, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus curvatus in arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 533</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 6, 6, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna curvata in cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 184</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronte curvatos imitatus ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imi (rami) in terram adeo curvantur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversum curvatur (arbor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insectorum pedes ... foris curvantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvata in montis faciem unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 361</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 509</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tollimur in caelum curvato gurgite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 564</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nostrum seri curvarent Aeacon anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 435</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">curvata senio membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondera vix toto curvatus corpore juxta Deicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:649" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 649</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12057.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make to yield, to move</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te munera nec ... vir curvat ( = movet, ad misericordiam flectit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CUST" /></sense></entryFree>
curvor: <entryFree id="n12058" type="main" key="curvor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>curvus</etym>, <sense id="n12058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crookedness</hi>, perh. only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 104</bibl>, and 7, § 25 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
curvus: <entryFree id="n12059" type="main" key="curvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">curvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vŏs</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root kar-, whence <foreign lang="greek">korw/nh</foreign>; cf.: circus, varus</etym>, <sense id="n12059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crooked, curved, bent</hi> (opp. rectus; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n12059.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 933</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1253" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rastri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 53" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:93" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equi) alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 7, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 352</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <trans><tr>winding, crooked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:520" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>rising on high, boisterous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:505 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 505 al.</bibl></cit>—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ita te adgerundā curvom aquā faciam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arator,</quote> <trans><tr>bent, stooping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 42</bibl></cit>; and of one <hi rend="ital">bent by age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 18, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel gibberosi vel curvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12059.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">crooked, wrong, perverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">curvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is crooked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wrong</hi> (opp. rectum): <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet ut possem curvo dignoscere rectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectum discernis, ubi inter Curva subit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenimus qui curva corrigeret,</quote> <trans><tr>set every thing right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (21), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">hic nobis curva corriget?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cuscolium: <entryFree id="n12060" type="hapax" key="cusco^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuscŏlĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cŭlĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scarlet berry of the holm oak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 12, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cusinius: <entryFree id="n12061" type="main" key="Cusinius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cusinius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 41, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cusio: <entryFree id="n12062" type="main" key="cu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cudo</etym>, <sense id="n12062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stamping of money</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 16, 18.</sense></entryFree>
cuso: <entryFree id="n12063" type="gloss" key="cu_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 890</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
cusor: <entryFree id="n12064" type="main" key="cu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coiner of money</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuspidatim: <entryFree id="n12065" type="hapax" key="cuspi^da_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuspĭdātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cuspido</etym>, <sense id="n12065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to a point, with a point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decisus calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuspido: <entryFree id="n12066" type="main" key="cuspi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuspĭdo</orth>, no <sense id="n12066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cuspis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make pointed, to point</hi> (only in the foll. pass.): <cit><quote lang="la">hastilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 126</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuspis: <entryFree id="n12067" type="main" key="cuspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n12067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a point, the pointed end</hi> of any thing (freq., esp. in the poets). </sense><sense id="n12067.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: asserum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 172</bibl></cit>. acuta contorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuta teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 78: jaculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:673" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:197" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 197</bibl></cit>: aquilae, <hi rend="ital">the pointed end of the standard;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stu/rac</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 62</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12067.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto). </sense><sense id="n12067.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A spear, javelin, lance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 673</bibl>; Liv 4, 38, 3 and 4; 8, 7, 9 and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:152 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 45, § 152 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12067.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A spit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:221:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 221, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12067.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The trident of Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 580</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">triplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:594" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 594</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12067.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sting of a bee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 45, § 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12067.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A scorpion's sting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 199</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12067.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pointed tube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuspius: <entryFree id="n12068" type="main" key="Cuspi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cuspĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 6, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cussiliris: <entryFree id="n12069" type="gloss" key="cussi^li_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cussĭlīris</orth>, <itype>is, e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root sku-, to cover, hide; cf.: obscurus, scutum</etym>, <sense id="n12069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cowardly</hi> (an ancient word for ignavus, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 13</bibl> Müll.).</sense></entryFree>
custodela: <entryFree id="n12070" type="main" key="custo_de_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custōdēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>custos</etym> (ante-class. form for custodia; in later Lat. preserved only in the vulgar lang.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=51:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 51, 5</bibl> Müll.), <sense id="n12070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watch, guard, care</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui more antiquo in custodelam suom conmiserunt caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in custodelam nos tuam ut recipias et tutere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(capram) in custodelam simiae concredere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: familiam pecuniamque tuam endo mandatelā tutelā custodelāque meā (esse aio), an ancient judicial formula in Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, § 104</bibl> Huschke: <cit><quote lang="la">feralis,</quote> <trans><tr>of a corpse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 193 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutaris carceris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 217, 15: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 245, 15.</sense></entryFree>
custodia: <entryFree id="n12071" type="main" key="custo_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custōdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watching, watch, guard, care, protection</hi> (freq. and <pb n="505" /> <cb n="CUST" /> class.). </sense><sense id="n12071.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12071.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuam custodiam meque et meas spes trado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare custodiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis impedimentis custodiae ac praesidio VI. milia hominum unā reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hospitum privatorum custodiā esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam fida canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paedagogorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura matrum,</quote> <trans><tr>care, oversight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">navium longarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis (Vestae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 10, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis, sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (sc. pontis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus, Auct. B. Alex. 17: cum in ejusdem anni custodiā te atque L. Murenam fortuna posuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid privatā custodiā continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum familias conventus Campaniae custodiae causā distribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in muro custodiae causā conlocati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 46: navis quae erat ad custodiam ab Acilio posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus adpositus custodiae (alicujus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignaviam suam tenebrarum ac parietum custodiis tegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a cujus audaciā fratris liberos ne materni quidem corporis custodiae tegere potuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fida justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una fidelis memoriae rerum gestarum (litterae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 57</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12071.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12071.4" n="1" level="3"> Usu. in <number>plur.</number> and in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">persons who serve as guards, a guard, watch, sentinel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia meis praesidiis, custodiis, vigiliis munita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque clam transire propter custodias Menapiorum possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 27</bibl> et saep.—In <number>sing.</number> (collect.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abest custodia regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicus anser erat, minimae custodia villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:684" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>a body-guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:42" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12071.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place where guard is kept, a watch-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guard - house, watch - station</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (urbs) mea sedes est, haec vigilia, haec custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac custodiā et tamquam speculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri in custodiam conditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12071.6" n="II" level="1"> With the access. idea of hindering free motion, <hi rend="ital">a watching, guarding, custody, restraint, confinement</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12071.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cuiquam uni custodiam ejus (sc. Philopoemenis capti) satis credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: quive (servi) inve ludum custodiamve conjecti fuerint, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal quod custodiam nostram evadit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulos vinclis atque custodiā ... tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praedonum hostiumque custodias tantum numerum civium Romanorum includere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera,</quote> <trans><tr>private custody, confinement in one's house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libero conclavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 9</bibl></cit>); and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liberis custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: domi teneamus eam (eloquentiam), saeptam liberali custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>.—Perh. in a play upon the words libera custodia: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sis apud me ligneā in custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12071.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12071.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place of confinement, a prison, hold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus comprehenditur et in custodiā necatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 104 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27</bibl>, §§ 68 and 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl> et saep. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis custodiis se liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12071.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Persons in confinement, captives, prisoners</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in recognoscendis custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ex custodiarum agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of a single person: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem catenā et custodiam et militem copulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
custodiarium: <entryFree id="n12072" type="main" key="custo_di^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custōdĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>custos</etym>, <sense id="n12072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watchhouse</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Martyr. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1391</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
custodiarius: <entryFree id="n12073" type="gloss" key="custo_di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custōdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jailer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1541</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
custodio: <entryFree id="n12074" type="main" key="custo_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custōdĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n12074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. pass.</hi> custodibitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 71</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to watch, protect, keep, defend, guard</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12074.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12074.2" n="A" level="2"> With material objects: Q. Caepio Brutus pro consule provinciam Macedoniam, tueatur, defendat, custodiat incolumemque conservet, <cb n="CUST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum corpus domumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me receperit, juverit, custodierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in meā salute custodiendā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me non solum amicorum fidelitas, sed etiam universae civitatis oculi custodiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec insula ab eā (Cerere) ... incoli custodirique videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimam oram viginti navibus longis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 2, 11</bibl></cit> (cf. tueri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 2, 7</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">officinam diligentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra nocte, ne quis elabi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma in melle,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay up, preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries, qui laevum marinae Veneris latus Custodit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic stilus ... me veluti custodiet ensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: se, <hi rend="ital">to be on the watch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto se opere custodiant bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac ut diligentissime te ipsum custodias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 17</bibl></cit>, A, 8.—</sense><sense id="n12074.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gortynii templum magnā curā custodiunt non tam a ceteris quam ab Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma ab insomni dracone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem a vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 25, § 89</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12074.4" n="B" level="2"> With immaterial objects (freq. in postAug. prose), <hi rend="ital">to keep, preserve, regard, take heed, observe, maintain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod tradatur posse percipere animo et memoriā custodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his (arboribus) quas memoria hominum custodit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 85, § 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae scriptis reposuimus, velut custodire desinimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum ubique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regulam loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae custodienda in olearam curā ... praecipiemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 29, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 12, 14, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiose quod juraveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:65:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 65, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12074.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneriores annos ab injuriā sanctitas docentis custodiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12074.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliis quoque propinquitatibus custodiendum est, ut inviti judicemur dixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in genere id est praecipue custodiendum, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:7" default="NO">8, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut custoditum sit ne umquam veniret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12074.7" n="II" level="1"> With the access. idea of hindering free motion, in a good or bad sense. </sense><sense id="n12074.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hold something back, to preserve, keep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum te oculi et aures non sentientem ... speculabuntur atque custodient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, ne quid auferat,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch, observe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (sc. epistulae) custodiendae et proferendae arbitrium tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodit se quamlibet custodiatur simulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12074.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to hold in custody, hold captive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu nervo vinctus custodibitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 71</bibl></cit>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem praedonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Verr. 2:5:27:section=68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 218</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">cu-stōdītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">cautiously, carefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut parce custoditeque ludebat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
custoditio: <entryFree id="n12075" type="main" key="custo_di_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custōdītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>custodio</etym>. <sense id="n12075.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">guardianship, care</hi>: custoditio est opera ad custodiendum quid sumpta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12075.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a keeping, observance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
custos: <entryFree id="n12076" type="main" key="custos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">custos</orth>, <itype>ōdis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>root sku-, to cover, hide, etc.; cf. scutum, <foreign lang="greek">keu/qw</foreign>, Germ. Haut, Haus, Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 353</etym>, <sense id="n12076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a guard, watch, preserver, keeper, overseer, protector, defender, attendant</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">protectress</hi>, etc., in a friendly or hostile sense (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12076.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12076.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings. </sense><sense id="n12076.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: antiqua erilis fida custos corporis, Enn. Med. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 39, 2</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 289 Vahl.); cf. in <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>a body-guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; so <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Commium cum equitatu custodis loco relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vigillis custodibusque nostris colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>. custos defensorque provinciae, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 6</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">12: pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae regiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: ipse pecuniae quam regni melior custos, Liv 44, 26, 12: rei <cb n="CUTI" /> publicae custos senatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:55:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 55, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos ac vindex cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">his discipulis privos custodes dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">teachers of youth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis (ego) verae custos rigidusque satelles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—Freq. of the gods, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dei custodes et conservatores hujus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">custodi Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium custos Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum Caesar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: multae tibi tum officient res, Custodes, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">attendants of women, eunuchs</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 98</bibl> Heind.—Of dogs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 406</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:424 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 424 al.</bibl></cit>, and of the constellation Bootes, <foreign lang="greek">*)arktofu/lac</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl>: armorum, <hi rend="ital">the officer in charge of the arms</hi> in an army or fleet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:14:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 14, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3630 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12076.4" n="2" level="3"> In civil affairs, t. t., <hi rend="ital">a man who took charge of the vessel into which voting tablets were put</hi> (in order to prevent false suffrages), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 7, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12076.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects. </sense><sense id="n12076.6" n="1" level="3"> Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">natura Ipsaque corporis est custos et causa salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec custos dignitatis (fortitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia custos et procuratrix totius hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges diligentissimae pudoris custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:19 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 19 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12076.7" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">receptacles, safes</hi>, e. g. of <hi rend="ital">a quiver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburnea Telorum custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 320</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">an incense-box</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 703</bibl></cit>; and in husbandry, <hi rend="ital">the stump of an amputated vine-branch</hi>, i. q. resex, pollex, praesidiarius or subsidiarius palmes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12076.8" n="II" level="1"> In a hostile sense. </sense><sense id="n12076.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a watch, spy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dumnorigi custodes ponit, ut, quae agat, quibuscum loquatur, scire possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodem, inquit, Tullio me apponite. Quid, mihi quam multis custodibus opus erit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num nam hic relictu's custos, Nequis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 59; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12076.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a jailer, keeper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ex Mauritania rex proditionis insimulatum cum custodibus miserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">te sub custode tenebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 60 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cusus: <entryFree id="n12077" type="main" key="Cusus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cusus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in</hi> Germania, now prob. the <hi rend="ital">Waag</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cuticula: <entryFree id="n12078" type="main" key="cu^ti_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭtīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cutis</etym>, <sense id="n12078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the skin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 18</bibl>; on the long <hi rend="ital">ī</hi>, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 612</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
