cutilia: <entryFree id="n12079" type="main" key="Cu^ti^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭtĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city in the Sabine land, on a lake called</hi> Lacus Cutiliae, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Contigliano</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 109</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:51:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 51, 8</bibl>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭtĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 6</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=51:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 51, 8</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭtĭlĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 71</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 28 sq.</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭtĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cutilia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cutiliae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 6, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:45" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 45</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭ-tĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cutina: <entryFree id="n12080" type="main" key="Cutina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cutina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the</hi> Vestini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cutio: <entryFree id="n12081" type="main" key="cu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small insect, milleped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Emp. 8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Emp. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cutis: <entryFree id="n12082" type="main" key="cu^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> cutem, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 14</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ku/tos</foreign>; Sanscr. gudh; Germ. Haut</etym>, <sense id="n12082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the skin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12082.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:183 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 183 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:123:7 al" default="NO">123, 7 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:128" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12082.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: curare cutem, <hi rend="ital">to take care of one's skin</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make much of one's self</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 15</bibl> (for which pelliculam curare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 38</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cogere aliquem intra suam cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cute perditus,</quote> <trans><tr>sick in one's body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:23" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te intus et in cute novi,</quote> <trans><tr>I know you thoroughly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12082.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12082.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hide, leather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceus est sartā terque quaterque cute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:103:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 103, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12082.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A soft coating, covering</hi> of any thing; <hi rend="ital">the skin, rind, surface</hi> (several times in the Nat. Hist. of Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">casiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucleorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15</bibl></cit>, <pb n="506" /> <cb n="CYBI" /> 28, 34, § <cit><quote lang="la">112: lauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 60, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 19, 79, § 207</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12082.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the external appearance, surface, outside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerā quādam elocutionis cute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem virtutis effingere et solam ut sic dixerim cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuturnium: <entryFree id="n12083" type="gloss" key="cuturni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuturnĭum</orth> <itype>vas, quo in sacrificiis vinum fundebatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=51:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 51, 1</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
cyamias: <entryFree id="n12084" type="main" key="cy^a^mi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyămĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cyamos</etym>, <sense id="n12084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the beanstone, a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyamos: <entryFree id="n12085" type="greek" key="cy^a^mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyămŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/amos</foreign>, <sense id="n12085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> colocasia, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian bean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 51, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyane: <entryFree id="n12086" type="main" key="Cy^a^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kua/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n12086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain near Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:469" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 469</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 10, 26</bibl>.—In fable, <hi rend="ital">a nymph changed into this fountain for her grief at the loss of Proserpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:409 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 409 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:515" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 515</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyaneae: <entryFree id="n12087" type="main" key="Cy_a^ne^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳănĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. cyaneus, II.</entryFree>
cyanee: <entryFree id="n12088" type="main" key="Cy_a^ne^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳănĕē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kuane/h</foreign>, <sense id="n12088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph, daughter of Mæander, mother of Caunus and of Byblis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 452</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyaneus: <entryFree id="n12089" type="greek" key="cy_a^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳănĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kua/neos</foreign>. <sense id="n12089.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dark-blue, sea-blue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyaneo colore avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 32, 47, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 858</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12089.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳănĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kua/neai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the two small rocky islands at the entrance of the Pontus Euxinus, called also</hi> Symplegades, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:561" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 561</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n12089.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳă-nĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Cyaneæ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:381" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:637" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:19:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:92 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 92 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12089.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">like the Cyaneæ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:99:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 99, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cyanos: <entryFree id="n12090" type="greek" key="cy^a^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyănŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/anos</foreign>. <sense id="n12090.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The blue corn-flower, blue-bottle</hi>: Centaurea cyanus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 24, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12090.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone, a species of</hi> lapis lazuli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 38, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyathisso: <entryFree id="n12091" type="greek" key="cy^a^thisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyăthisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kuaqi/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n12091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill a</hi> cyathus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> de Diff. 41, 8</bibl>; Auct. de Verb. 8, § 14 Jan.</sense></entryFree>
cyathus: <entryFree id="n12092" type="greek" key="cy^a^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/aqos</foreign>, <sense id="n12092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small ladle for transferring the wine from the mixing-bowl</hi> (crater) <hi rend="ital">to the drinking-cup</hi> (cf. Becker, Gall. 3, p. 221). </sense><sense id="n12092.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=124" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 124</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12092.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">a measure</hi>, both dry and liquid (particularly for wine), <hi rend="ital">the twelfth part of a</hi> sextarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 85</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">ten Greek drachmæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 34, 109, § 185</bibl>; cf. Rhemn. Fann. Pond. 80.</sense></entryFree>
cybaeus: <entryFree id="n12093" type="greek" key="cy^baeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cybaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ku/ph, kubh/</foreign>, cupa</etym>, <sense id="n12093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a kind of merchantship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cybaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a transport</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merchant-ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cybele: <entryFree id="n12094" type="main" key="Cy^be^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybĕlē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybēbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybĕ-lă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kube/lh</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*kubh/bh</foreign>. <sense id="n12094.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A goddess, originally Phrygian, later worshipped in Rome also as</hi> Ops <hi rend="ital">or</hi> Mater Magna, <hi rend="ital">whose priests were called</hi> Galli. </sense><sense id="n12094.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form Cybele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 768</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:71:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 71, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12094.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form Cybela, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12094.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Form Cybebe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl> (4, 16), 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:365" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:3" default="NO">17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 600</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12094.4" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12094.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybĕ-lēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., pertaining to Cybele</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 104</bibl></cit>; v. Attis: mater, i. q. <hi rend="ital">Cybele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 507</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the lions in the chariot of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of her temple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:176" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12094.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybĕlista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kubelisth/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a priest of Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 25</bibl> Sillig ex conj. (al. Calybita). —</sense><sense id="n12094.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Phrygia</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12094.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Form Cybele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:249" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 363</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12094.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Form Cybebe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:84" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 84</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybĕ-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 111</bibl> Rib. (al. Cybelae).</sense></entryFree>
cybiarius: <entryFree id="n12095" type="spur" key="cy^bi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cybĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cybium</etym>, <sense id="n12095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in salt fish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 70</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
cybicus: <entryFree id="n12096" type="main" key="cy^bi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cybĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. cubicus.</entryFree>
cybindis: <entryFree id="n12097" type="main" key="cy^bindis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cybindis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cymin-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/bindis</foreign>, <sense id="n12097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the night hawk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnus accipiter cybindis vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cybiosactes: <entryFree id="n12098" type="greek" key="Cy^bi^o^sactes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybĭŏsactes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kubiosa/kths</foreign>, <sense id="n12098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in salt fish; nickname of the thirteenth Ptolemy</hi>, and later of <hi rend="ital">the emperor Vespasian</hi>, Suét. Vesp. 19.</sense></entryFree>
cybistra: <entryFree id="n12099" type="main" key="Cybistra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cybistra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Cappadocia</hi>,<cb n="CYCN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 2</bibl> and 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cybium: <entryFree id="n12100" type="greek" key="cy^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cybĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/bion</foreign>. <sense id="n12100.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tunny-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 3</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 15</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n12100.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dish made of pieces of the tunny-fish salted and chopped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:79:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 79, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyceon: <entryFree id="n12101" type="greek" key="cy^ce^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cycĕōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kukew/n</foreign>, <sense id="n12101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink made of barley-grits, grated goats'-cheese, and wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 174 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cychramus: <entryFree id="n12102" type="greek" key="cychra^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cychrămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/xramos</foreign>, <sense id="n12102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird migrating with quails</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the ortolan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:23:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33</bibl>, §§ 66 and 68.</sense></entryFree>
cycladatus: <entryFree id="n12103" type="hapax" key="cycla^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyclădātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cyclas</etym>, <sense id="n12103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed with a</hi> cyclas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyclades: <entryFree id="n12104" type="main" key="Cy_cla^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳclădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. cyclas, II.</entryFree>
cyclaminos: <entryFree id="n12105" type="greek" key="cycla^mi_no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyclămīnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 27, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kukla/mi=nos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">kukla/mi^non</foreign>, <sense id="n12105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant sowbread</hi>: Cyclamen Europaeum, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">of several kinds,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:114 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 67, § 114 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cyclas: <entryFree id="n12106" type="greek" key="cy_clas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳclas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kukla/s</foreign> (circular; hence as in Greek; cf. <sense id="n12106.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Liddell and Scott in h. v. l.),</quote> <trans><tr>a state-robe of women, with a border running round it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:259" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 259</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Sat. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 649 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12106.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳclădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kukla/des</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Cyclades, islands lying in a circle round Delos, in the Ægean Sea, off the coast of the Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:65 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 65 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:183" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 183</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:563" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 563</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:347" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 804" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 804</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyclicus: <entryFree id="n12107" type="greek" key="cy^cli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyclĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kukliko/s</foreign>, prop. circular; hence, <sense id="n12107.0" n="I" level="1"> Cyclicus scriptor, <hi rend="ital">a cyclic poet, one of the epic poets who treated in regular order the cycle of myths from the beginning of the world to the time of Telemachus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyclica carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>cyclic poems</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. Liddell and Scott, s. v. <foreign lang="greek">kukliko/s</foreign>, II.—</sense><sense id="n12107.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Forming a complete cycle, encyclopædic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 998</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cyclophoreticus: <entryFree id="n12108" type="greek" key="cy_^clo^pho^re_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^clŏphŏrētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kukloforhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moved in a circle, circular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, p. 275</bibl></cit> (written as Greek by Kopp, § 814).</sense></entryFree>
cyclops: <entryFree id="n12109" type="main" key="Cy_^clops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳ^clops</orth>, <itype>ōpis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -ōpem or -ōpa), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/klwy</foreign> (a round eye), <sense id="n12109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cyclops;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclopes, um,</quote> <trans><tr>the Cyclopes, a fabulous race of giants on the coast of Sicily; said to have each but one eye, and that in the middle of the forehead; to them were ascribed the walls called Cyclopean; plur</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57</bibl>, §§ 195-198; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 630</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 424</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 305</bibl> et saep.; <number>sing.</number> <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Cyclops Polyphemus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 617</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:744 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 744 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 174</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclopa saltare,</quote> <trans><tr>to imitate Polyphemus by pantomime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 125</bibl></cit> Orell.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n12109.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n12109.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳ^clōpēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kuklw/peios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Cyclopean, of the Cyclopes;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">plur</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳ^clōpēa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the myth of the Cyclopes as represented in a pantomime</hi>: ludere, Treb. Poll. Gall. 8, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12109.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳ^clōpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Cyclopes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa, in Sicily,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Mycenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 997" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 997</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:33" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cyclus: <entryFree id="n12110" type="greek" key="cy_^clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^clus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/klos</foreign>, <sense id="n12110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n12110.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cycli axium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12110.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12110.3" n="A" level="2"> Astron. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a cycle, recurring period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paschalis,</quote> <trans><tr>the Easter cycle of ninety-five years</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <trans><tr>the lunar cycle of nineteen years</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12110.4" n="B" level="2"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a periodic change, a recurrence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resumptionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metasyncriticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cyclo curare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12110.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument for branding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cycnarium: <entryFree id="n12111" type="main" key="cy_^cna_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^cnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ku/knos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n12111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4234</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cycneius: <entryFree id="n12112" type="main" key="Cy_cne_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳcnēïus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cȳgn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Boeotian Cycnus, the son of Hyrie</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempe,</quote> <trans><tr>in Bœotia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 371</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cycneus: <entryFree id="n12113" type="greek" key="cy_cne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳcnēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cȳgn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/kneios</foreign>. <sense id="n12113.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a swan, swan's-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam cycnea vox et oratio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the last speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12113.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳcnēa</orth> (al. <cb n="CYLL" /> Cygnaea) Specula, <hi rend="ital">a hill near Brixia</hi>, now still <hi rend="ital">Cigneo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cycnus: <entryFree id="n12114" type="greek" key="cy_^cnus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^cnus</orth> (in MSS. and edd. freq. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^gnus</orth>; <sense id="n12114.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">y,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 20, 8</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/knos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the swan;</hi> celebrated for its singing, esp. for its dying song; <cit><quote lang="la">consecrated to Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:910" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 910</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 393</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 20</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">attached to the chariot of Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 708</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 809</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12114.1" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contendat hirundo cycnis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also: certent cycnis ululae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12114.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dircaeus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pindar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12115" type="main" key="Cy_^cnus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳ^cnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cȳ^g-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n12115.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Ligurians, son of Sthenelus, related to Phæton, who was changed to a swan and placed among the stars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 189</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 154" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 3, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12115.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Neptune and Calyce; he was father of Tenes, and was changed into a swan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:72 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 72 sq.</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 157" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 157</bibl>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">cydărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/daros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of ship</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cydippe: <entryFree id="n12116" type="main" key="Cy_dippe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳdippē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kudi/pph</foreign>. <sense id="n12116.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mistress of Acontius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 457</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12116.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Nereid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 339</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
cydnos: <entryFree id="n12117" type="main" key="Cydno^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydnŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/dnos</foreign>, <sense id="n12117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Cilicia, famed for its cold and tonic waters</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kara - Su</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Tersustschai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:1" default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:13 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cydonia: <entryFree id="n12118" type="main" key="Cy^do_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydōnĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydōnēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kudwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n12118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient and celebrated town on the north coast of Crete</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Canea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12118.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12118.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n12118.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Cydonian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 858</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12118.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Phorcus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 325</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 229</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12118.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydō-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cydonian</hi>: spicula, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 59</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq. Cydonia (and Latinized cotonia, cotonea) mala; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cydōnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏtōnĭa</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏtōnĕa</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quince</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quince-apple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 13, 27.—Cydonia arbor, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cydōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quince-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Insit. 99 al.</bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">cydōnĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">quincejuice, quince-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12118.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cy-dōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cydonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 293</bibl></cit>: pharetrae, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:339" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:261" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12118.7" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydōnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cydonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cy-dōnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">quince-wine</hi> (cf. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12118.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cydōnĭātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cydonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 60, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cygneius: <entryFree id="n12119" type="main" key="Cy_gne_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳgnēïus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cȳgnēus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳ^gnus</orth>, v. Cycn-.</entryFree>
cylindratus: <entryFree id="n12120" type="hapax" key="cy^lindra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cylindrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cylindrus</etym>, <sense id="n12120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a cylinder, cylindrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siliquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 33, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cylindrus: <entryFree id="n12121" type="greek" key="cy^lindrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cylindrus</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/lindros</foreign>, <sense id="n12121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cylinder</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12121.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 19, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12121.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12121.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cylindrical stone for levelling the ground, a roller</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 46, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12121.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone ground off in the form of a cylinder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:61 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 61 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cyllaros: <entryFree id="n12122" type="main" key="Cylla^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllărŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/llaros</foreign>. <sense id="n12122.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 393</bibl> and 408.—</sense><sense id="n12122.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The horse of Pollux, given to him by Juno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:327" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:426" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 426</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:21:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:8" default="NO">8, 28, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyllene: <entryFree id="n12123" type="main" key="Cylle_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs and ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kullh/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n12123.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A high mountain in the north-eastern part of Arcadia, on which</hi>, acc. to the myth, <hi rend="ital">Mercury was born and brought up;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">consecrated to him</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 30, 45, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:276" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 276</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 139</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12123.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n12123.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllēnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cyllenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 258</bibl></cit>; in this sense also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllēnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 252</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 276</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 713</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 720</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12123.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Mercury</hi>: proles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cephalus</hi>, son of Mercury by Creüsa, Ov. A. <pb n="507" /> <cb n="CYME" /> A. 3, 725: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>the planet Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 337</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12123.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllēnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cyllenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides, i. e. lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a constellation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=627" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 627</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12123.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllēnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., Cyllenian</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of Mercury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harpe,</quote> <trans><tr>possessed by Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the foot of Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:500" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 500</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12123.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cyllē-nĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one sprung from Cyllene</hi>, of Mercury, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 899</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12123.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12123.8" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nymph, nurse of Mercury</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 252</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cylonius: <entryFree id="n12124" type="main" key="Cy^lo_ni_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cylōnīus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kulw/neios</foreign>, <sense id="n12124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cylon, the well-known Athenian</hi>: scelus = <foreign lang="greek">a)/gos *kulw/neion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the crime committed by the murder of Cylon's partisans at the altar of Athene, where they had sought asylum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyma: <entryFree id="n12125" type="greek" key="cy_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūma</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n12125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young sprout of a cabbage; neutr.</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:129" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 129</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54:3" default="NO">12, 54, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:137 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 137 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 35, § 90 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12125.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hollow sphere, spherical layer, stratum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (naturarum) circa ... centron, aquae primum, aërisque sequens, tertium ignis cyma commemorant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 814</bibl></cit> Kopp ad loc.; cf. the context.</sense></entryFree>
cymaeus: <entryFree id="n12126" type="main" key="Cy_maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Cyme, II.</entryFree>
cymatilis: <entryFree id="n12127" type="main" key="cy_ma^ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳmătĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. cumatilis.</entryFree>
cymatium: <entryFree id="n12128" type="greek" key="cy_ma^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳmătĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūm-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kuma/tion</foreign> (a small wave); in architecture, <sense id="n12128.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The volute of an Ionic column</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12128.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A channel, a waved moulding, an ogee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3, 8</bibl>; 4, 6, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cymba: <entryFree id="n12129" type="greek" key="cymba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymba</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cumba</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/mbh</foreign>, <sense id="n12129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boat, skiff</hi>, first used by the Phœnicians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 57, § 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:in Non. p. 535:31" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> in Non. p. 535, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:777 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 777 al.</bibl>—In partic., <hi rend="ital">the boat of Charon which transported the dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 18, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:186" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12129.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est ingenii cymba gravanda tui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>meddle not with themes above your powers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 22; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cymbalaris: <entryFree id="n12130" type="main" key="cymba^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> cotyledon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cymbalicus: <entryFree id="n12131" type="greek" key="cymba^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kumbaliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a cymbal</hi>: voces, Ven. Carm. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cymbalisso: <entryFree id="n12132" type="greek" key="cymba^lisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kumbali/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n12132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike the cymbals</hi>, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cymbalista: <entryFree id="n12133" type="greek" key="cymba^lista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kumbalisth)s</foreign>, <sense id="n12133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cymbal-player</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 49, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cymbalistria: <entryFree id="n12134" type="greek" key="cymba^listri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălistrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kumbali/stria</foreign>, <sense id="n12134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female cymbal-player</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2449 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cymbalitis: <entryFree id="n12135" type="main" key="cymba^li_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kumbali=tis</foreign>, sc. herba, = cymbalaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Emp. 14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Emp. 14</bibl>.</entryFree>
cymbalum: <entryFree id="n12136" type="greek" key="cymba^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbălum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n12136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> cymbalum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 21</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ku/mbalon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a cymbal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12136.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">an instrument consisting of two hollow plates of brass, which emit a ringing sound when struck together</hi>. They were used in the festivals of Cybele and Bacchus, and on other festive occasions; also to hinder the flight of bees, etc. (usu. in <number>plur.</number>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 619</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:29" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:213" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12136.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in hydraulics, <hi rend="ital">a sounding basin of similar form, a bell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12136.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Apion Grammaticus, hic quem Tiberius Caesar cymbalum mundi vocabat, i. e. as making the world ring with his ostentatious disputations, Plin. H. N. praef. § 25; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 7, 5</bibl> Wagn.; App. Orth. § 8 p. 129 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
cymbium: <entryFree id="n12137" type="greek" key="cymbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kumbi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n12137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small drinking-vessel, a cup, bowl</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 545, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=51:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 51, 10</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n12137.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lamp in the same form</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261</bibl>. 40.</sense></entryFree>
cymbula: <entryFree id="n12138" type="hapax" key="cymbu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cymba</etym>, <sense id="n12138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyme: <entryFree id="n12139" type="main" key="Cy_me_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n12139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Æolis, near the mod. Sanderli</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sandarlio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12139.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <cb n="CYNO" /> <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cyme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenagoras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antigonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Cyme</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n12140" type="main" key="Cy_me_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmē</orth>, v. Cumae.</entryFree>
cyminatus: <entryFree id="n12141" type="main" key="cy^mi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. cuminatus.</entryFree>
cymindis: <entryFree id="n12142" type="greek" key="cy^mindis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymindis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. cybindis.</entryFree>
cymine: <entryFree id="n12143" type="main" key="Cymi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cymīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyminum: <entryFree id="n12144" type="main" key="cy^mi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cuminum.</entryFree>
cymodoce: <entryFree id="n12145" type="main" key="Cy_mo^do^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmŏdŏcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmŏdŏcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Nereid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 826</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 225</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
cymosus: <entryFree id="n12146" type="hapax" key="cy_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cȳmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cyma</etym>, <sense id="n12146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of shoots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:138" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cymothoe: <entryFree id="n12147" type="main" key="Cy_mo^tho^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cȳmŏthŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kumoqo/h</foreign>. <sense id="n12147.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Nereid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 26, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:58 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 58 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12147.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Achaia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cymula: <entryFree id="n12148" type="main" key="cy^mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cymŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cyma</etym>, <sense id="n12148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tender sprout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coriandri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cyna: <entryFree id="n12149" type="greek" key="cyna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cyna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree in Arabia that produced cotton</hi>: Bombax ceiba, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 11, 22, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynacantha: <entryFree id="n12150" type="greek" key="cy^na^cantha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cynăcantha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kuna/kanqa</foreign>, <sense id="n12150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dog-thorn, dog-rose;</hi> perh. Rosa canina, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 35, 41, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynaegirus: <entryFree id="n12151" type="greek" key="Cy^naegi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynaegīrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kunai/geiros</foreign>, <sense id="n12151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian, famous for his valor in the battle of Marathon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynamolgi: <entryFree id="n12152" type="greek" key="Cy^na^molgi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynămolgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kunamolgoi/</foreign> (dog-milkers), <sense id="n12152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild tribe of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynanche: <entryFree id="n12153" type="greek" key="cy^nanche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cynanchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kuna/gxh</foreign>, <sense id="n12153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inflammation of the throat, which caused the tongue to be thrust out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynapes: <entryFree id="n12154" type="main" key="Cy^na_pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynāpes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n12154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river which empties into the Euxine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynegetica: <entryFree id="n12155" type="greek" key="Cy^ne_ge^ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynēgĕtĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> ( = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ kunhgetika/</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">kunhgetiko/s</foreign>, venaticus, pertaining to the chase), <sense id="n12155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Cynegetics, the name given to poems on hunting by Gratius Faliscus and Nemesianus in Latin, and by Oppianus in Greek</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
cyneus: <entryFree id="n12156" type="main" key="Cy^ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/neios</foreign> (of Dogs): <sense id="n12156.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the Hellespont</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 111" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:243" default="NO">243</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynice: <entryFree id="n12157" type="main" key="Cy^ni^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Cynicus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12158" type="greek" key="Cy^ni^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kunikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n12158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Cynic sect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynicus: <entryFree id="n12159" type="greek" key="Cy^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kuniko/s</foreign> (doglike). <sense id="n12159.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst., a Cynic philosopher, a Cynic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudi dolia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Diogenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 309</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Cynic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14</bibl></cit>; and in * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cynĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of the Cynics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12159.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Suffering by</hi> <foreign lang="greek">spasmo\s kuniko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">spasmodic distortion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 24, § 60</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cyniola: <entryFree id="n12160" type="main" key="cy^ni^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cynĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lettuce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 4, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cynismus: <entryFree id="n12161" type="greek" key="cy^nismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cynismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kunismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n12161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Cynical philosophy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
